Broadcom Corporation Proprietary and Confidential

3. Supported Events

1. Supported Commands

 

Section 7.1: Link Control Commands

OGF 0x01
Command Name OCF SupportedComments
Inquiry   0x001 YesInquiry_Length=0 indicates infinite inquiry length 
Inquiry_Cancel   0x002 YesDoes not cancel an inquiry that resulted from Periodic_Inquiry_Mode 
Periodic_Inquiry_Mode   0x003 Yes 
Exit_Periodic_Inquiry_Mode   0x004 Yes 
Create_Connection   0x005 Yes 
Disconnect   0x006 Yes 
Add_SCO_Connection   0x007 YesSupported for Bluetooth 1.1 compatibility, but deprecated. Setup_Synchronous_Connection is preferred. 
Create_Connection_Cancel   0x008 Yes 
Accept_Connection_Request   0x009 Yes 
Reject_Connection_Request   0x00A Yes 
Link_Key_Request_Reply   0x00B Yes 
Link_Key_Request_Negative_Reply   0x00C Yes 
PIN_Code_Request_Reply   0x00D Yes 
PIN_Code_Request_Negative_Reply   0x00E Yes 
Change_Connection_Packet_Type   0x00F Yes 
Authentication_Requested   0x011 Yes 
Set_Connection_Encryption   0x013 Yes 
Change_Connection_Link_Key   0x015 Yes 
Master_Link_Key   0x017 Yes 
Remote_Name_Request   0x019 Yes 
Remote_Name_Request_Cancel   0x01A Yes 
Read_Remote_Supported_Features   0x01B Yes 
Read_Remote_Extended_Features   0x01C Yes 
Read_Remote_Version_Information   0x01D Yes 
Read_Clock_Offset   0x01F Yes 
Read_LMP_Handle   0x020 Yes 
Setup_Synchronous_Connection   0x028 YesCan support up to 3 links of SCO or eSCO or a acombination of SCO+eSCO 
Accept_Synchronous_Connection_Request   0x029 YesCan support up to 3 links of SCO or eSCO or a acombination of SCO+eSCO 
Reject_Synchronous_Connection_Request   0x02A Yes 
IO_Capability_Response   0x02B Yes 
User_Confirmation_Request_Reply   0x02C Yes 
User_Confirmation_Request_Negative_Reply   0x02D Yes 
User_Passkey_Request_Reply   0x02E Yes 
User_Passkey_Request_Negative_Reply   0x02F Yes 
Remote_OOB_Data_Request_Reply   0x030 Yes 
Remote_OOB_Data_Request_Negative_Reply   0x033 Yes 
IO_Capability_Request_Negative_Reply   0x034 Yes 
Enhanced_Setup_Synchronous_Connection   0x03D YesCan support up to 3 links of SCO or eSCO or a acombination of SCO+eSCO 
Enhanced_Accept_Synchronous_Connection_Request   0x03E YesCan support up to 3 links of SCO or eSCO or a acombination of SCO+eSCO 
Truncated_Page   0x03F Yes 
Truncated_Page_Cancel   0x040 Yes 
Set_Connectionless_Broadcast   0x041 Yes 
Set_Connectionless_Broadcast_Receive   0x042 Yes 
Start_Synchronization_Train   0x043 Yes 
Receive_Synchronization_Train   0x044 Yes 
Remote_OOB_Extended_Data_Request_Reply_Command   0x045 Yes 
 

Section 7.2: Link Policy Commands

OGF 0x02
Command Name OCF SupportedComments
Hold_Mode   0x001 Yes 
Sniff_Mode   0x003 Yes 
Exit_Sniff_Mode   0x004 Yes 
Park_Mode   0x005 Yes 
Exit_Park_Mode   0x006 Yes 
QoS_Setup   0x007 YesFirmware will try to ensure the throughput is guaranteed by deducing a correlated Tpoll value from the Token_Rate parameter together with the packet type that is enabled at the time this command is issued. Once a desirable token rate is deduced, the firmware will send LMP_quality_of_service_req to the remote device. If the remote device accepts the Tpoll, the firmware will send a "QoS Setup Complete" event to the host. When the firmware receives LMP_quality_of_service_req, it will send accept as long as the Tpoll is larger than 2 slots in single connection scenario, or Tpoll is larger than 4 slots in a multiple connection scenario. 
Role_Discovery   0x009 Yes 
Switch_Role   0x00B Yes 
Read_Link_Policy_Settings   0x00C Yes 
Write_Link_Policy_Settings   0x00D Yes 
Read_Default_Link_Policy_Settings   0x00E Yes 
Write_Default_Link_Policy_Settings   0x00F Yes 
Flow_Specification   0x010 Yes 
Sniff_Subrating   0x011 Yes 
 

Section 7.3: Host Controller & Baseband Commands

OGF 0x03
Command Name OCF SupportedComments
Set_Event_Mask   0x001 Yes 
Reset   0x003 Yes 
Set_Event_Filter   0x005 Yes 
Flush   0x008 Yes 
Read_PIN_Type   0x009 Yes 
Write_PIN_Type   0x00A Yes 
Create_New_Unit_Key   0x00B YesDon't support local unit key since unit key is less secure, but will accept if peer sends unit key 
Read_Stored_Link_Key   0x00D No 
Write_Stored_Link_Key   0x011 No 
Delete_Stored_Link_Key   0x012 No 
Write_Local_Name   0x013 Yes 
Read_Local_Name   0x014 Yes 
Read_Connection_Accept_Timeout   0x015 Yes 
Write_Connection_Accept_Timeout   0x016 Yes 
Read_Page_Timeout   0x017 Yes 
Write_Page_Timeout   0x018 YesPage_Timeout=0 indicates infinite timeout period

Write_Scan_Enable   0x01A Yes

Write_Page_Scan_Activity   0x01C Yes

Write_Num_Broadcast_Retransmissions   0x02A Yes 
Read_Hold_Mode_Activity   0x02B Yes 
Write_Hold_Mode_Activity   0x02C Yes 
Read_Transmit_Power_Level   0x02D YesThe requested transmit power returned as a signed char in the range of 0 to -28 in 4 dbm steps. Note that this is different from the enumerated values used by the Set_Transmit_Power vendor-specific command. 
Read_Synchronous_Flow_Control_Enable   0x02E No 
Write_Synchronous_Flow_Control_Enable   0x02F No 
Set_Host_Controller_To_Host_Flow_Control   0x031 YesACL only

Command Name OCF SupportedComments

Section 7.5: Status Parameters

OGF 0x05
Command Name OCF SupportedComments
Read_Failed_Contact_Counter   0x001 Yes 
Reset_Failed_Contact_Counter   0x002 Yes 
Get_Link_Quality   0x003 Yes 
Read_RSSI   0x005 YesGolden range is -52 to -72 dbm. Note that this command will return the RSSI associated with the last received packet. 
Read_AFH_Channel_Map   0x006 Yes 
Read_BD_Clock   0x007 Yes 
Read_Encryption_Key_Size   0x008 Yes 
Get_MWS_Transport_Layer_Configuration   0x00C Yes 
Set_Triggered_Clock_Capture   0x00D Yes 
 

Section 7.6: Testing Commands

OGF 0x06
Command Name OCF SupportedComments
Read_Loopback_Mode   0x001 Yes 
Write_Loopback_Mode   0x002 Yes 
Enable_Device_Under_Test_Mode   0x003 Yes

2. Broadcom-Specific Command Definitions

Write_BD_ADDR

OCF 0x001

Description:

This command will write the value for the device's Bluetooth device address.



Command Parameters:

BD_ADDR Size: 6 bytes

    Type: Bluetooth device address

The Bluetooth device address




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Read_Page_Scan_Repetition_Mode

OCF 0x004

Description:

This command will read the value of the SR bits that are set in the FHS packet during transmission during inquiry scan response.



Command Parameters:

None



Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


Page_Scan_Repetition_Mode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Indicates the maximum interval between two successive page scans.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  R0  
 0x1  R1  
 0x2  R2  







Write_Page_Scan_Repetition_Mode

OCF 0x005

Description:

This command will Write the value of the SR bits that are set in the FHS packet during transmission during inquiry scan response. Overrides value assigned by HC as determined by PS activity. Command for testing only.



Command Parameters:

Page_Scan_Repetition_Mode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Indicates the maximum interval between two successive page scans.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  R0  
 0x1  R1  
 0x2  R2  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Super_Peek_Poke

OCF 0x00A

Description:

Allows the RF registers and memory space (XDATA space for 8051-based chips) to be read or written. The parameters present are dependent on what memory space is being read or written and whether the access is a read or a write.



Command Parameters:

Access_Type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Selects which memory or register space type is to be read or written, and whether it is to be read or written.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  8051_XDATA_Peek  
 0x1  BlueRF_Peek  
 0x2  BlueRF_Poke  
 0x3  8051_XDATA_Poke  
 0x4  ARM_Memory_Peek  
 0x5  ARM_Memory_Poke  
 0x6  PMU_Peek  
 0x7  PMU_Poke  


XDATA_Address Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (big endian)

Present for XDATA reads and writes on 8051-based chips. Specifies the XDATA address to be read or written.


BlueRF_Address Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Present for RF register reads and writes. Specifies the RF register address to be read or written.


ARM_Memory_Address Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Present for memory reads and writes on ARM-based chips. Specifies the memory address to be read or written. For writes, the memory address must fall on a 32-bit address boundary.


PMU_Reg_Offset Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Present for PMU register reads and writes. Specifies the PMU register address to be read or written.


Value8 Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Present for XDATA writes on 8051-based chips, or RF or PMU register writes on all chips. Specifies the value to be written.


Value32 Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Present for memory writes on ARM-based chips. Specifies the value to be written.




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


Value Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

The value read, which is only valid if the access type was a read.







Write_Local_Supported_Features

OCF 0x00B

Description:

This command will write the device's local supported features. Overrides the locally supported feature settings. Note that this command is used exclusively for testing purposes and should be used with great care.



Command Parameters:

LMP_Features Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Bits 31:0 of the LMP_Features bitmap.

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00000001  3-slot packets  
 0x00000002  5-slot packets  
 0x00000004  Encryption  
 0x00000008  Slot offset  
 0x00000010  Timing accuracy  
 0x00000020  Switch  
 0x00000040  Hold mode  
 0x00000080  Sniff mode  
 0x00000100  Park mode  
 0x00000200  Power control requests  
 0x00000400  Channel quality driven data rate  
 0x00000800  SCO link  
 0x00001000  HV2 packets  
 0x00002000  HV3 packets  
 0x00004000  u-law log  
 0x00008000  A-law log  
 0x00010000  CVSD  
 0x00020000  Paging scheme  
 0x00040000  Power control  
 0x00080000  3 transparent SCO data  
 0x00100000  Flow control lag (bit0)  
 0x00200000  Flow control lag (bit1)  
 0x00400000  Flow control lag (bit2)  
 0x00800000  Broadcast encryption  
 0x01000000  Scatter mode  
 0x02000000  Enhanced data rate ACL 2 Mbps mode  
 0x04000000  Enhanced data rate ACL 3 Mbps mode  
 0x08000000  Enhanced inquiry scan  
 0x10000000  Interlaced inquiry scan  
 0x20000000  Interlaced page scan  
 0x40000000  RSSI with inquiry results  
 0x80000000  Extended SCO link (EV3 packets)  


LMP_Features (63:32) Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Bits 63:32 of the LMP_Features bitmap.

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00000001  EV4 packets  
 0x00000002  EV5 packets  
 0x00000004  Absence masks  
 0x00000008  AFH capable slave  
 0x00000010  AFH classification slave  
 0x00000020  LE BR/EDR not supported  
 0x00000040  LE supported (Controller)  
 0x00000080  3-slot enhanced data rate ACL packets  
 0x00000100  5-slot enhanced data rate ACL packets  
 0x00000200  Sniff subrating  
 0x00000400  Pause Encryption  
 0x00000800  AFH capable master  
 0x00001000  AFH classification master  
 0x00002000  Enhanced data rate eSCO 2 Mbps mode  
 0x00004000  Enhanced data rate eSCO 3 Mbps mode  
 0x00008000  3-slot enhanced data rate eSCO packets  
 0x00010000  Extended inquiry response  
 0x00020000  Simultaneous LE and BR/EDR to the same device capable (Controller)  
 0x00080000  Secure Simple Pairing  
 0x00100000  Encapsulated PDU  
 0x00200000  Erroneous Data Reporting  
 0x00400000  Non-flushable Packet Boundary Flag  
 0x01000000  Link Supervision Timeout Changed Event  
 0x02000000  Inquiry Response Tx Power Level  
 0x04000000  Enhanced Power Control  
 0x80000000  Extended features  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Super_Duper_Peek_Poke

OCF 0x00C

Description:

Allows the RF registers and memory space to be read or written. The parameters present are dependent on what memory space is being read or written and whether the access is a read or a write.



Command Parameters:

Access_Type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Selects which memory or register space type is to be read or written, and whether it is to be read or written.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  BlueRF_Peek  
 0x1  BlueRF_Peek_Multi  
 0x2  BlueRF_Poke  
 0x3  ARM_8bit_Memory_Peek  
 0x4  ARM_8bit_Memory_Peek_Multi  
 0x5  ARM_8bit_Memory_Poke  
 0x6  ARM_32bit_Memory_Peek  
 0x7  ARM_32bit_Memory_Peek_Multi  
 0x8  ARM_32bit_Memory_Poke  
 0x9  ARM_8bit_Fifo_Peek_Multi  
 0xA  ARM_8bit_Fifo_Poke_Multi  
 0xB  ARM_16bit_Memory_Peek  


Address Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

The address to be read or written.


Count Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

The number of values to be read or written, starting at Address.


Value Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

For poke operations, the value to be written.


Data Size: up to 240 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint8 array

The data to write to the target 8 bits fifo address.




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


Access_Type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

The type of peek or poke was processed.


Address Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

The address or starting address that was read or written.


Count Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

The number of values returned. For pokes or single (as opposed to multiple) peeks, the value will be irrelevant, but faithfully indicated as being 1.


Data Size: up to 240 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint8 array

The data read from the target 8bits fifo.


Value[0] Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

The value that was read from the specified address. If an 8-bit read was processed, the value will be padded with zeros to a big endian 32-bit value. To read RAM in a more compact form with the capacity for a greater length, use Read_RAM instead.







Sleep_Forever_Mode

OCF 0x013

Description:

This command will force the device to enter sleep immediately. The device will stay asleep until woken up by the host via the BT-Wake line when using the UART transport or USB Resume when using the USB interface.



Command Parameters:

None



Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Set_Tx_Carrier_Frequency_ARM

OCF 0x014

Description:

For 2045, put radio into manual mode for tx tests



Command Parameters:

Carrier_Enable Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Used to turn the carrier on and off

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Carrier on  
 0x1  Carrier off  


Carrier_Frequency_Encoded Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

If Carrier_Enable is 0, Bluetooth frequency minus 2400


Carrier_Frequency Size: 0 bytes (abstract)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

An abstraction of Carrier_Frequency_Encoded as Bluetooth frequency in Mhz


Mode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

If Carrier_Enable is 0, selects unmodulated or modulated with pattern

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Unmodulated  
 0x1  PRBS9  
 0x2  PRBS15  
 0x3  All Zeros  
 0x4  All Ones  
 0x5  Incrementing Symbols  


Modulation Type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

If Carrier_Enable is 0, 1 Mbps, 2Mbps, or 3 Mbps selection, ignored if Mode is Unmodulated

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  GFSK  
 0x1  QPSK  
 0x2  8PSK  
 0x3  LE  


Transmit_Power Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

If Carrier_Enable is 0, requested power table index

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  0 dBm  
 0x1  -4 dBm  
 0x2  -8 dBm  
 0x3  -12 dBm  
 0x4  -16 dBm  
 0x5  -20 dBm  
 0x6  -24 dBm  
 0x7  -28 dBm  
 0x8  Specify Power in dBm  
 0x9  Specify Power Table index  


Transmit_Power_dBm Size: 1 byte

    Type: int8

If Carrier_Enable is 0 and Transmit_Power is Integer override, requested output power in dbm


Transmit_Power_Table_Index Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

If Carrier_Enable is 0 and Transmit_Power is Table index override, requested table index




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Set_Encryption_Key_Size

OCF 0x016

Description:

This command sets local device acceptable encryption key sizes.



Command Parameters:

Key_Size Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Key Size Tier Word specifying acceptable key sizes as bit positions, e.g. 0x9001 means acceptable key sizes are 16, 13, and 1.

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0001  Accept 8-bit key  
 0x0002  Accept 16-bit key  
 0x0004  Accept 24-bit key  
 0x0008  Accept 32-bit key  
 0x0010  Accept 40-bit key  
 0x0020  Accept 48-bit key  
 0x0040  Accept 56-bit key  
 0x0080  Accept 64-bit key  
 0x0100  Accept 72-bit key  
 0x0200  Accept 80-bit key  
 0x0400  Accept 88-bit key  
 0x0800  Accept 96-bit key  
 0x1000  Accept 104-bit key  
 0x2000  Accept 112-bit key  
 0x4000  Accept 120-bit key  
 0x8000  Accept 128-bit key  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Update_UART_Baud_Rate

OCF 0x018

Description:

Changes the baud rate at which the UART transport communicates. A Command Complete event will be generated at the previous baud rate. If the Command Complete event indicates success, the UART transport will then shift to the new baud rate.



Command Parameters:

Encoded_Baud_Rate Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

The hardware register representation of the new baud rate. The value is determined by a formula described below. For the BCM2045, the value of Encoded_Baud_Rate can be 0x0000, which implies that the encoded form is not used and the actual baud rate follows. When using the UART transport of the BCM2045 in three-wire SLIP (H5) mode, if Update_UART_Baud_Rate is issued, use of the encoded form is disallowed. If the encoded form is used, the value is determined as follows:

 // Upper four bits
 uint32 encoded_segment = ( ( (24000000 / baud_rate) % 16 ) / 2 );
 encoded_baud_rate = ( ( (uint16)encoded_segment ) << 4 );
 
 // Lower four bits of high nibble
 encoded_segment = ( ( ( (24000000 / baud_rate) % 16 ) / 2 ) +
                     ( ( (24000000 / baud_rate) % 16 ) % 2 ) );
 encoded_baud_rate |= (uint16)encoded_segment;
 
 // Lower byte
 encoded_segment = ( 256 - ( (24000000 / baud_rate) / 16 ) );
 encoded_baud_rate |= (encoded_segment << 8);
Note: the above formula is only based on 24 MHz UART clock. For the BCM2048, we could select either 24MHz or 48MHz, so the above calculate will not work with 48MHz UART clock.


Use_Encoded_Form Size: 0 bytes (abstract)

    Type: boolean

An abstraction of whether the encoded form is to be used. If not using the encoded form of baud rate, the Encoded_Baud_Rate parameter will be 0x0000, and a four-byte baud rate in integer form will follow in the Explicit_Baud_Rate parameter.


Explicit_Baud_Rate Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (big endian)

If Encoded_Baud_Rate is 0x0000 and therefore the encoded form of baud rate is not being used, the Explicit_Baud_Rate parameter will be present, containing the baud rate in integer form.


Baud_Rate Size: 0 bytes (abstract)

    Type: uint32 (big endian)

An abstraction of the baud rate, whether present in the command in encoded form in the Encoded_Baud_Rate or included as Explicit_Baud_Rate.




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Set_Testmode_Type

OCF 0x01B

Description:

Sets a global to identity the master device in testmode



Command Parameters:

Master Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Identity of the master device

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Broadcom  
 0x1  Equipment  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Write_SCO_PCM_Int_Param

OCF 0x01C

Description:

This command will write SCO and PCM interface parameters.



Command Parameters:

SCO_Routing Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Specifies whether the SCO path is through PCM interface or transport

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  PCM  
 0x1  Transport  
 0x2  CODEC  
 0x3  I2S  


PCM_Interface_Rate Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Specifies the PCM clock frequency.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  128 KBps  
 0x1  256 KBps  
 0x2  512 KBps  
 0x3  1024 KBps  
 0x4  2048 KBps  


Frame_Type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Specifies the PCM frame type: short frame or long frame

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Short  
 0x1  Long  


Sync_Mode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Specifies whether Bluetooth module to be the master or slave for PCM_SYNC signal

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Slave  
 0x1  Master  


Clock_Mode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Specifies whether Bluetooth module to be the master or slave for PCM_CLK signal

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Slave  
 0x1  Master  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Read_SCO_PCM_Int_Param

OCF 0x01D

Description:

This command will read SCO and PCM interface parameters.



Command Parameters:

None



Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


SCO_Routing Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Indicates whether the SCO path is through PCM interface or transport

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  PCM  
 0x1  Transport  
 0x2  CODEC  
 0x3  I2S  


PCM_Interface_Rate Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Indicates the PCM clock frequency.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  128 KBps  
 0x1  256 KBps  
 0x2  512 KBps  
 0x3  1024 KBps  
 0x4  2048 KBps

Write_PCM_Data_Format_Param

OCF 0x01E

Description:

This command will write PCM data format parameters.



Command Parameters:

LSB_First Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

Specifies whether the LSB bit is shifted out first or not for serial PCM data


Fill_Bits Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Specifies the value with which to fill unused bits if Fill_Method is set to programmable


Fill_Method Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Specifies the method of filling unused data bits

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  0's  
 0x1  1's  
 0x2  Signed  
 0x3  Programmable  


Fill_Num Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Specifies the number of bits to be filled


Right_Justify Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

Specifies the data to right justify (fill data shifted out first) or not. Default is left justify (fill data shifted out last).




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

This command will read PCM data format parameters.

LSB_First Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

Indicates whether the LSB bit is shifted out first or not for serial PCM data


Fill_Bits Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Specifies the value with which to fill unused bits if Fill_Method is set to programmable

Right_Justify Size: 1 byte

Write_PCM_Loopback_Mode

OCF 0x024

Description:

This command will write PCM Loopback Mode.

PCM_Data_Dump_Enable Size: 7 bits {7:1} in uint8

    Type: unsigned integer

PCM data dump vendor-specific debug events enable/disable. At present, enabling this feature is only supported by BCM2047 or BCM2044.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00  PCM data dump disable  
 0x40  POM data dump enable  


PCM_Loopback_Mode Size: 1 bit {0} in uint8

    Type: boolean

Loopback on/off selection, 0 - loopback off, 1 - loopback on.
