Set_Transmit_Power

OCF 0x026

Description:

This command will adjust the transmit power attenuation on a per connection basis.



Command Parameters:

Connection_Handle Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

The connection handle of the link for which to adjust the transmit power


Max Tx Power Level Size: 1 byte

    Type: int8

The index into the power table array




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Set_Sleepmode_Param

OCF 0x027

Description:

This command will activate the selected sleep mode algorithm and specify respective timer thresholds.



Command Parameters:

Sleep_Mode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Sleep mode algorithm selection.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  No sleep mode  
 0x1  UART  
 0x2  UART with messaging  
 0x3  USB  
 0x4  H4IBSS  
 0x5  USB with host wake  
 0x6  SDIO  
 0x7  UART CS-N  
 0x8  SPI  
 0x9  H5  
 0xA  H4DS  
 0xC  UART with BREAK  


Idle_Threshold_Host Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Host Idle Threshold, applicable To Sleep Modes 1, 2, 5, 7. This is the number of firmware loops executed with no activity before the Host wake line is deasserted. Activity includes HCI traffic excluding certain sleep mode commands and the presence of SCO connections if the "Allow Host Sleep During SCO" flag is not set to 1. Each count of this parameter is roughly equivalent to 300 ms. For example, when this parameter is set to 16 (0x10), the Host wake line will be deasserted after approximately 4.8 seconds of inactivity.


Idle_Threshold_HC Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Host Controller Idle Threshold, applicable To Sleep Modes 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 and 9. This is the number of firmware loops executed with no activity before the HC is considered idle. Depending on the mode, HC may then attempt to sleep. Activity includes HCI traffic excluding certain sleep mode commands and the presence of ACL/SCO connections. Each count of this parameter is roughly equivalent to 300 ms. For example, when this parameter is set to 16 (0x10), the HC will be considered idle after approximately 4.8 seconds of inactivity.


BT_WAKE_Active_Mode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Applicable To Sleep Modes 1, 2, 7. This flag indicates whether the BT_WAKE line is active low or high. GPIO0 is typically used for BT_WAKE.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Active Low  
 0x1  Active High  


HOST_WAKE_Active_Mode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Applicable To Sleep Modes 1, 2, 5, 7. This flag indicates whether the HOST_WAKE line is active low or high. GPIO3 is typically used for HOST_WAKE on BCM2035, and GPIO1 on ARM-based chips.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Active Low  
 0x1  Active High  


Allow_Host_Sleep_During_SCO Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

Applicable To Sleep Modes 1, 2, 3, 5, 7. When this flag is set to 0, the host is not allowed to sleep while an SCO is active. In modes 1 and 2, the device will keep the host wake line asserted while an SCO is active. In mode 3, the device will immediately issue a USB RESUME if the host issues a SUSPEND. When this flag is set to 1, the host can sleep while an SCO is active. This flag should only be set to 1 if SCO traffic is directed to the PCM interface.


Combine_Sleep_Mode_And_LPM Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

Applicable To Sleep Modes 1, 2, 3, 5, 7. In Mode 0, always set byte 7 to 0. In all sleep modes, device always requires permission to sleep between scans / periodic inquiries regardless of the setting of this byte. In Modes 1 and 2, if byte is set, device must have "permission" to sleep during the low power modes of sniff, hold, and park. If byte is not set, device can sleep without permission during these modes. Permission to sleep in Mode 1 is obtained if the BT_WAKE signal is not asserted. Permission to sleep in Mode 2 occurs after the Sleep Request / Sleep Request ACK exchange. In Mode 3 and 5, if the byte is set to 0, the device will not be able to sleep during the low power modes. If it is set to 1, the device will be able so sleep during the low power modes.


Enable_Tristate_Control_Of_UART_Tx_Line Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

Applicable To Sleep Modes 1, 2, 7. When set to 0, the device will not tristate its UART TX line before going to sleep.
When set to 1, the device will tristate its UART TX line before going to sleep.


Active_Connection_Handling_On_Suspend Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Suspend Behavior, applicable To Sleep Modes 3, 5. When set to 0, this flag indicates that upon detecting a USB suspend, the device should sleep whenever possible. This means that the device will stay up if necessary to maintain active ACL and/or SCO connections, and will wake up to perform any scheduled periodic activities if configured to do so. When set to 1, the device will immediate go to sleep upon detecting a USB SUSPEND and will not wake up until USB RESUME is detected. This will cause all connections (whether ACL or SCO, parked or not, etc.) to be dropped. All periodic activity will also be suspended. When this flag is set to 1, all other parameters are ignored.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Maintain connections; sleep when timed activity allows  
 0x1  Sleep until resume is detected  


Resume_Timeout Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Applicable To Sleep Modes 3, 5. After the device issues a USB RESUME, it will wait this many seconds for the Host to resume USB operations before issuing another USB RESUME. If this value is set to 0, the device will never reissue RESUME and will instead wait forever for the host to act on the initial RESUME.


Enable_BREAK_To_Host Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

Applicable To Sleep Mode 12. If 0 and sleep mode 12 is selected, disables setting a break condition to the host, making the sleep mechanism unidirectional.


Pulsed_HOST_WAKE Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

Applicable To Sleep Modes 1, 12. After asserting BT_WAKE (mode 1) or setting or clearing a BREAK condition (mode 12), if the host does not wake up, clear the condition and retry.




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Read_Sleepmode_Param

OCF 0x028

Description:

This command will read back sleep mode related parameters.



Command Parameters:

None



Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


Sleep_Mode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

See Set_Sleepmode_Param.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  No sleep mode  
 0x1  UART  
 0x2  UART with messaging  
 0x3  USB  
 0x4  H4IBSS  
 0x5  USB with host wake  
 0x6  SDIO  
 0x7  UART CS-N  
 0x8  SPI  
 0x9  H5  
 0xA  H4DS  
 0xB  HIDD  
 0xC  UART with BREAK  


Idle_Threshold_Host Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

See Set_Sleepmode_Param.


Idle_Threshold_HC Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

See Set_Sleepmode_Param.


BT_WAKE_Active_Mode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

See Set_Sleepmode_Param.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Active Low  
 0x1  Active High  


HOST_WAKE_Active_Mode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

See Set_Sleepmode_Param.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Active Low  
 0x1  Active High  


Allow_Host_Sleep_During_SCO Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

See Set_Sleepmode_Param.


Combine_Sleep_Mode_And_LPM Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

See Set_Sleepmode_Param.


Enable_Tristate_Control_Of_UART_Tx_Line Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

See Set_Sleepmode_Param.


Active_Connection_Handling_On_Suspend Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

See Set_Sleepmode_Param.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Maintain connections; sleep when timed activity allows  
 0x1  Sleep until resume is detected  


Resume_Timeout Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

See Set_Sleepmode_Param.


Enable_BREAK_To_Host Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

See Set_Sleepmode_Param.


Pulsed_HOST_WAKE Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

See Set_Sleepmode_Param.







Sleepmode_Command

OCF 0x029

Description:

This command will allow to control the device's sleep mode. This command should only be used with UART transport.



Command Parameters:

Command Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

New sleep mode command, response to a sleep mode command received in the vendor specific sleep mode event, or acknowledgement of having woken up in response to a hardware wakeup signal.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x1  Sleep Req ACK  
 0x2  Sleep Req NACK  
 0x3  Sleep Req  
 0x4  Wakeup Req ACK  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Delay_Peripheral_SCO_Startup

OCF 0x02A

Description:

This command will control delay of SCO peripheral. This command should only be used with UART transport.



Command Parameters:

Enable_Delay Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

1 - delay SCO peripheral startup
0 - do not delay SCO peripheral startup




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Write_Receive_Only

OCF 0x02B

Description:

This command will set receive frequency. Used for RF testing only.



Command Parameters:

Receive_Frequency_Encoded Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

This is a Byte value indicating the frequency, which the receiver will camp on as an offset in MHz from 2400 Mhz. Valid values are from 2 to 80.


Receive_Frequency Size: 0 bytes (abstract)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

An abstraction of Receive_Frequency_Encoded to indicate the actual frequency, from 2402 to 2480 MHz to to simplify use of the command from scripts or the user interface.




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







RF_Config_Settings

OCF 0x02D

Description:

Read the Register Value



Command Parameters:

CommandType Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Command ID

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  TX_Path  
 0x1  RX_Path  
 0x2  TX_Power_Control_Modes  


Tx_Path_settings Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Tx switch settings

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  LP Tx 0dBm  
 0x1  HP Tx 13dBm (IQ mod)  
 0x2  HP Tx 20dBm (IQ mod)  


Rx_Path_Settings Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Rx_Path_Settings

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  LP Rx  
 0x1  HP Rx  


TX_Power_Control_Modes Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

TX_Power_Control_Modes

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Tx 20/13dBm Paths  
 0x1  Tx 13dBm Path Only  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


Returned_Data Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

sub_status







Download_Minidriver

OCF 0x02E

Description:

The command will trigger the device to reboot into a state where it is prepared to receive download of a minidriver.



Command Parameters:

None



Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Crystal_PPM

OCF 0x02F

Description:

This command takes the PPM error measurement and calculates the associated RF_Trim and IF_Trim values that correct the clocks. The user may also enter the IF_Trim and RF_Trim values directly. The trim values may be committed to EEPROM if that option is chosen. For backward compatibility, ARM-based products do accept the 8051 calculated mode values, but in that case, all parameters other than PPM are ignored, and in that compatibility mode, the Factory_Commit option is not supported.



Command Parameters:

Mode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

The mode by which crystal information is provided.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  8051 calculated  
 0x1  8051 if_trim and rf_trim  
 0x2  ARM  
 0x3  2042 calculated  


Freq_Int_Part Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Only applicable if Mode is 8051 calculated or ARM. Frequency whole integer part (values between 0 and 40 MHz) e.g. 19 for 19.68.


Freq_Fract_Part Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Only applicable if Mode is 8051 calculated or ARM. Frequency fractional part (values from 0 to 255 in units of 1/256 MHz) e.g. 256*0.68 for 19.68.


PPM Size: 1 byte

    Type: int8

Amount to trim the center frequency by, in 1 PPM steps. A positive value will cause the center frequency to increase, while a negative value will cause the center frequency to decrease. Only applicable if Mode is 8051 calculated or ARM. For 8051 calculated mode, the PPM value is absolute, with the trim being reapplied to the untrimmed base frequency represented in Freq_Int_Part and Freq_Fract_Part each time this function is called. Note that when an ARM-based product is emulating the 8051 calculated mode, the Freq_Int_Part and Freq_Fract_Part parameters are ignored, but the PPM value is still absolute. For ARM mode, the PPM value is relative to the current center frequency, which may have already been trimmed.


IF_Trim Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Only applicable if Mode is 8051 if_trim and rf_trim. Value used directly instead of calculation from MHz frequency and PPM information.


RF_Trim Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Only applicable if Mode is 8051 if_trim and rf_trim. Value used directly instead of calculation from MHz frequency and PPM information.


Factory_Commit Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

If 1, commit the (possibly calculated) IF_Trim and RF_Trim values to nonvolatile memory. For the 8051 modes, this operation is supported only if an EEPROM is installed. For ARM mode, this operation is supported if either an EEPROM or flash has been installed and pre-programmed with an inactive RF_PLL Trim configuration item. That item has a type code of 0xFD, and the int32 PPM value contained in the configuration item must have been set to 0xFFFFFFFF. The Factory_Commit option may be executed once and only once.


2042_Register_Settings Size: 11 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint8 array

Jim to document!




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Set_Power_Amp_Bias

OCF 0x030

Description:

This command sets the power amp bias value.



Command Parameters:

Hot_Temp_Bias Size: 4 bits {7:4} in uint8

    Type: unsigned integer

The power amp bias when the chip is hot. Corresponds to an applied attenuation of between 0 and 6 db in 2 db increments. If the radio max output is nominally +3db, this command will reduce the output to a value in the range of +3 db to -3 db.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  0 dB  
 0x1  -2 dB  
 0x2  -4 dB  
 0x3  -6 dB  


Warm_Temp_Bias Size: 2 bits {3:2} in uint8

    Type: unsigned integer

The power amp bias when the chip is warm. Corresponds to an applied attenuation of between 0 and 6 db in 2 db increments. If the radio max output is nominally +3db, this command will reduce the output to a value in the range of +3 db to -3 db.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  0 dB  
 0x1  -2 dB  
 0x2  -4 dB  
 0x3  -6 dB  


Cold_Temp_Bias Size: 2 bits {1:0} in uint8

    Type: unsigned integer

The power amp bias when the chip is cold. Corresponds to an applied attenuation of between 0 and 6 db in 2 db increments. If the radio max output is nominally +3db, this command will reduce the output to a value in the range of +3 db to -3 db.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  0 dB  
 0x1  -2 dB  
 0x2  -4 dB  
 0x3  -6 dB  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Set_AFH_Behavior

OCF 0x032

Description:

This command configs AFH RSSI scan behavior



Command Parameters:

bypassScan Size: 1 bits {15:15} in little endian uint16

    Type: unsigned integer

Bypass RSSI scan

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Run RSSI scan  
 0x1  Bypass RSSI scan  


filterRxRssi Size: 1 bits {14:14} in little endian uint16

    Type: unsigned integer

Enable filter passive RSSI values

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  No filtering  
 0x1  Filtering  


enAbsReclaimTh Size: 1 bits {13:13} in little endian uint16

    Type: unsigned integer

Enable absolute reclaim RSSI threshold

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Relative RSSI thresholding for reclaim  
 0x1  Absolute RSSI thresholding for reclaim  


avoidLeAdChs Size: 1 bits {12:12} in little endian uint16

    Type: unsigned integer

Avoid BLE ad. channels

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Don't  
 0x1  Do  


enforceRules Size: 1 bits {11:11} in little endian uint16

    Type: unsigned integer

Enforce association rules

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Do not enforce association rules  
 0x1  Enforce association rules  


bypassCC Size: 1 bits {10:10} in little endian uint16

    Type: unsigned integer

bypassCC

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Run channel classification  
 0x1  Bypass channel classification  


considerSlaveMap Size: 1 bits {9:9} in little endian uint16

    Type: unsigned integer

slave map

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Ignore slave maps  
 0x1  Take slave maps into consideration  


scan_coex Size: 1 bits {8:8} in little endian uint16

    Type: unsigned integer

coex

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Ignore coex settings  
 0x1  Take coex maps into consideration  


hdrFecTuple Size: 5 bits {7:3} in little endian uint16

    Type: unsigned integer

Number of FEC tuple errors before classifying to bad packets for statistics only


site_survey Size: 1 bits {2:2} in little endian uint16

    Type: unsigned integer

FEC

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Normal operation (scan with links)  
 0x1  Scan without links  


afhcc_log Size: 2 bits {1:0} in little endian uint16

    Type: unsigned integer

Logging

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  No log  
 0x1  RSSI log  
 0x2  CC log  
 0x3  RSSI and CC log  


PLL_Settling_Time Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Settling time in us for most channels


Extra_Settling_Time Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Settling time in us for the first swithced-in channels


afhccAsscRuleEn Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Enable bit for assocation rules


PER_Shift Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Shift factor for channel PER filter [1-6]


minPackets Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Min. packets before enable PER based condemnation


lazyResetTh Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Threshold for lazy reset


bci_modem_clk Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Modem Clock (MHz)


bci_swp_duration Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Sweep duration (us)


bci_pause_1 Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Pause_1 (us)


bci_pause_2 Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Pause_2 (us)


rxSensitivity Size: 1 byte

    Type: int8

RX sensitivity from the eye of AFH


rxMaxGain Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

RX chain gains (dB)


rxrssi_th Size: 1 byte

    Type: int8

Threshold for good/weak signal level (dBm)


condemnCnt Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Number of RSSI scans release condemning a channel


condemnSnrGoodSig Size: 1 byte

    Type: int8

SNR margin for condemning under good signal level


condemnSnrWeakSig Size: 1 byte

    Type: int8

SNR margin for condemning under weak signal level


regroupTh Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Number of CC runs before reclaim all channel for defragmentation purpose


syncToTh Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Sync TO margin for condemning under strong signal level


swp_th_high Size: 1 byte

    Type: int8

High threshold of sweep (dBm)


calDelay Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Delay for RF calibration (us)


bciChOffset Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Channel offset number


absCondemnTh Size: 1 byte

    Type: int8

Absolute RSSI threshold for future-proof ETSI regulation


absReclaimTh Size: 1 byte

    Type: int8

Absolute RSSI threshold for reclaim


bleRssiTh Size: 2 bytes

    Type: int16

BLE RSSI threshold for condemnation




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Read_BTW_Security_Key

OCF 0x033

Description:

Reads the BTW security key for the device. The security key enables use of the device with the BTW Bluetooth stack.



Command Parameters:

None



Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


Data Size: 16 bytes

    Type: uint8 array

The security key. The value is obtained from the device's configuration data, and must match the Bluetooth device address to validate that the device is licensed for use with BTW.







Enable_Radio

OCF 0x034

Description:

This command turns the radio on or off (airplane mode if off).



Command Parameters:

Enable_Radio Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

1 - Enable the radio
0 - Disable the radio




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Write_RF_Reprogramming_Table

OCF 0x03C

Description:

This command modifies default RF register settings. This command is only supported by flash based systems or systems with the required patch installed.



Command Parameters:

Number_Of_Entries Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Number of settings to modify.


Register_Offset[0] Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

RF Register offset for the associated entry. This parameter will be repeated for Number_Of_Entries, with all array parameters interleaved according to Bluetooth standard array parameter treatment.


Register_Value[0] Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

RF Register value for the associated entry. This parameter will be repeated for Number_Of_Entries, with all array parameters interleaved according to Bluetooth standard array parameter treatment.




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Read_Collaboration_Mode

OCF 0x040

Description:

This command reads WLAN/Bluetooth Collaboration Configurations.



Command Parameters:

None



Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


CS_Encoded Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Bit 7 will be set to 0 for BCM2035, otherwise it will be set to 1.
For BCM2035:
    Bits 1:0: 2035_Collaboration_Solution
        0 - No collaboration
        1 - 2 pin 2 pin solution
        2 - 4 pin 2 pin solution
    Bits 6:2: GPIO_PCM_Interface
        0 - GPIO1/GPIO7 (uart interface configuration
        1 - PCM_IN/PCM_OUT (used with uart or usb when PCM is not required)
        2 - GPIO1/GPIO0 (usb interface when sideband power signalling not required)
        3 - GPIO6/GPIO5 (uart or usb when EEPROM is not in system)
        4 - GPIO4/GPIO5 (uart or usb when EEPROM is not in system)
For other devices:
    Bits 6:0: 2045_Collaboration_Solution
        0 - No collaboration
        1 - 2 pin 2 pin solution
        2 - 3 pin 2 pin solution
        3 - WCS


Architecture Size: 0 bytes (abstract)

    Type: uint8

An abstraction from CS_Encoded to indicate which architecture the response pertains to.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  2035  
 0x1  2045  


2045_Collaboration_Solution Size: 0 bytes (abstract)

    Type: uint8

An abstraction from CS_Encoded to indicate, for devices other than BCM2035, which collaboration solution is enabled.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  No collaboration  
 0x1  2 pin 2 pin solution  
 0x2  3 pin 2 pin solution  
 0x3  WCS  


Priorities Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Not present for BCM2035 command. Defines the priorities of Bluetooth tasks. A 0 bit indicates a low priority task, a 1 bit indicates a high priority task.

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00000001  STANDBY  
 0x00000002  LOW_PRI_CONNECTION  
 0x00000004  AFH_RSSISCAN  
 0x00000008  BROADCAST  
 0x00000010  INQUIRY  
 0x00000020  PAGE  
 0x00000040  CONNECTION  
 0x00000080  DONT_RESET_LCU_MASTER_SCO (2048 only)  
 0x00000100  TPOLL  
 0x00000200  INQSCAN  
 0x00000400  PAGESCAN  
 0x00000800  MASTER_SLAVE_SWITCH  
 0x00001000  NEW_CONNECTION  
 0x00002000  SCAN_INVERSE_PRI_DURING_SCO  
 0x00004000  MODULO  
 0x00008000  HOLD  
 0x00010000  SNIFF  
 0x00020000  PARK  
 0x00040000  SCO  
 0x00080000  ESCO  
 0x00100000  HI_PRI_PAGESCAN  
 0x00200000  HI_PRI_CONNECTION  
 0x00400000  SLAVE_POLL_LMP  
 0x00800000  DISABLE_COEX_IF_AFH_ENABLE  
 0x01000000  DEFER_HIGH_PRIORITY_FRAME (3 wires only)  
 0x02000000  INCREASE_PRIORITY_AFTER_DEFFER_ENABLED  
 0x04000000  DONT_RESET_LCU (2048 only)  
 0x08000000  NON_CONNECTION_HW_SUPPORT (2048 only)  
 0x40000000  PAGE_SCAN_HW_SUPPORT_BIT_0 (2048 only)  
 0x80000000  PAGE_SCAN_HW_SUPPORT_BIT_1 (2048 only)  


Channel_ID Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for non-BCM2035 command when WCS collaboration solution is selected. A value of 16 is not a valid WLAN channel ID, and therefore a value of 16 will preserve allow the WLAN hardware to preserve its channel ID assignment. Any other value will force the WLAN to use the specified channel ID.


Number_Bypassed Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for non-BCM2035 command when WCS collaboration solution is selected. The number of Bluetooth channels to be blocked across a WLAN channel.


RESERVED_1 Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Only present for non-BCM2035 command when WCS collaboration solution is not selected. This serves to pad the Command Complete event to the same size for all non-BCM2035 responses.


Priority_Inverse_Threshold Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for non-BCM2035 command. Effective if INCREASE_PRIORITY_AFTER_DEFFER_ENABLED is enabled. This paramter defines after how many frames defered by the WLAN, the the priority of that defered frame will be increased


Configuration_Flags_1 Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Additional configuration flags.

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00000001  COEX auto selection   
 0x00000002  COEX auto pad config   
 0x00100000  Back power workaround   
 0x00200000  Sample Rx   
 0x00400000  Dynamic LCU reset   
 0x00800000  Simurx workaround   
 0x01000000  5Wire support   
 0x02000000  A2DP_ACL_Priority_inv   
 0x04000000  EIR scan mode   
 0x08000000  Nonconnection LCU reset   
 0x10000000  Connection HW support   
 0x40000000  Nonconnection multi-sampling   
 0x80000000  HW coexistence mode   
 0x00010000  BLE COEX Nokia Mode  
 0x00008000  BLE COEX Enable  


Configuration_Flags_2 Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Additional configuration flags.

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x02000000  BLE Connection high priority  
 0x01000000  BLE INIT high priority  
 0x00800000  BLE SCAN high priority  
 0x00400000  BLE ADV high priority  
 0x40000000  PS and FHS low priority  
 0x80000000  LMP high priority  


2035_Collaboration_Solution Size: 0 bytes (abstract)

    Type: uint8

An abstraction from CS_Encoded to indicate, for BCM2035, which collaboration solution is enabled.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  No collaboration  
 0x1  2 pin 2 pin solution  
 0x2  4 pin 2 pin solution  


GPIO_PCM_Interface Size: 0 bytes (abstract)

    Type: uint8

An abstraction from CS_Encoded to indicate, for BCM2035, which GPIOs are in use for collaborative coexistance.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  GPIO1/GPIO7 (uart interface configuration)  
 0x1  PCM_IN/PCM_OUT (used with uart or usb when PCM is not required)  
 0x2  GPIO1/GPIO0 (usb interface when sideband power signalling not required)  
 0x3  GPIO6/GPIO5 (uart or usb when EEPROM is not in system)  
 0x4  GPIO4/GPIO5 (uart or usb when EEPROM is not in system)  


Low_Priority_Frame_Timer Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is not set to disable collaborative coexistance. The timer controls how much delay will add on for low priority tasks. For example, ACL throughput is consider low priority relative to WLAN throughput. Units are in Bluetooth Frames (1.25ms).


RESERVED_3 Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to disable collaborative coexistance. This byte serves to pad the Command Complete event to the same size for all BCM2035 responses.


RESERVED_4 Size: 33 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint8 array

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is not set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. These bytes serve to pad the Command Complete event to the same size for all BCM2035 responses.


PAGE_R0_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to R0 page.


PAGE_R1_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to R1 page.


PAGE_R2_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to R2 page.


PAGE_SCAN_R0_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to R0 page scan.


PAGE_SCAN_R1_L_200MS_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to R1 page scan when the scan window is less than 200ms.


PAGE_SCAN_R1_G_200MS_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to R1 page scan when the scan window is greater than 200ms.


PAGE_SCAN_R2_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to R2 page scan.


PAGE_RESPONSE_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to page response.


INQUIRY_RESPONSE_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to inquiry response.


ACL_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to ACL data transmission.


HID_ACTIVE_SNIFF_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to HID active sniff.


HID_LP_SNIFF_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to HID low power sniff.


HID_NON_HID_SNIFF_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to sniff for devices other than HIDs.


HID_RETURN_FROM_PARK_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to returning a HID from a parked state.


STANDBY_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to the IDLE task.


AFH_RSSI_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to AFH RSSI.


BROADCAST_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to broadcasting.


INQUIRY_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to inquiry.


PAGE_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to paging.


TPOLL_EXPIRE_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned when Tpoll is the scheduled task in a master role.


TPOLL_SNIFFTRANS_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to the sniff transition mode.


INQUIRY_SCAN_1_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to inquiry scan, mode 1 ( RX ID).


INQUIRY_SCAN_2_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to inquiry scan, mode 2 (RX ID and TX FHS).


PAGE_SCAN_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to page scan.


M_S_SWITCH_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to negotiating a master/slave switch.


NEW_CONNECTION_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to new connection mode (POLL/NULL exchange).


8051_CMD_CONN_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to the initial connection setup mode.


MODULO_CALC_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned when a modulo calulation is done for park or sniff.


RETURN_FROM_HOLD_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to returning from a hold state.


SNIFF_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to sniff.


SCO_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to SCO.


PARK_BEACON_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to a park beacon.


AFH_INSTANT_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to an AFH instant.







Write_Collaboration_Mode

OCF 0x041

Description:

This command writes WLAN/Bluetooth Collaboration Configurations.



Command Parameters:

CS_Encoded Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Bit 7 must be set to 0 for BCM2035, otherwise it must be set to 1.
For BCM2035:
    Bits 1:0: 2035_Collaboration_Solution
        0 - No collaboration
        1 - 2 pin 2 pin solution
        2 - 4 pin 2 pin solution
    Bits 6:2: GPIO_PCM_Interface
        0 - GPIO1/GPIO7 (uart interface configuration
        1 - PCM_IN/PCM_OUT (used with uart or usb when PCM is not required)
        2 - GPIO1/GPIO0 (usb interface when sideband power signalling not required)
        3 - GPIO6/GPIO5 (uart or usb when EEPROM is not in system)
        4 - GPIO4/GPIO5 (uart or usb when EEPROM is not in system)
For other devices:
    Bits 6:0: 2045_Collaboration_Solution
        0 - No collaboration
        1 - 2 pin 2 pin solution
        2 - 3 pin 2 pin solution
        3 - WCS         4 - WiMax


Architecture Size: 0 bytes (abstract)

    Type: uint8

An abstraction of bit 7 of CS_Encoded to indicate which architecture the command pertains to.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  2035  
 0x1  2045  


2045_Collaboration_Solution Size: 0 bytes (abstract)

    Type: uint8

An abstraction from CS_Encoded to indicate, for devices other than BCM2035, which collaboration solution to enable.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  No collaboration  
 0x1  2 pin 2 pin solution  
 0x2  3 pin 2 pin solution  
 0x3  WCS  


Priorities Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Not present for BCM2035 command. Defines the priorities of Bluetooth tasks. A 0 bit indicates a low priority task, a 1 bit indicates a high priority task.

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00000001  STANDBY  
 0x00000002  LOW_PRI_CONNECTION  
 0x00000004  AFH_RSSISCAN  
 0x00000008  BROADCAST  
 0x00000010  INQUIRY  
 0x00000020  PAGE  
 0x00000040  CONNECTION  
 0x00000080  DONT_RESET_LCU_MASTER_SCO (2048 only)  
 0x00000100  TPOLL  
 0x00000200  INQSCAN  
 0x00000400  PAGESCAN  
 0x00000800  MASTER_SLAVE_SWITCH  
 0x00001000  NEW_CONNECTION  
 0x00002000  SCAN_INVERSE_PRI_DURING_SCO  
 0x00004000  MODULO  
 0x00008000  HOLD  
 0x00010000  SNIFF  
 0x00020000  PARK  
 0x00040000  SCO  
 0x00080000  ESCO  
 0x00100000  HI_PRI_PAGESCAN  
 0x00200000  HI_PRI_CONNECTION  
 0x00400000  SLAVE_POLL_LMP  
 0x00800000  DISABLE_COEX_IF_AFH_ENABLE  
 0x01000000  DEFER_HIGH_PRIORITY_FRAME (3 wires only)  
 0x02000000  INCREASE_PRIORITY_AFTER_DEFFER_ENABLED  
 0x04000000  DONT_RESET_LCU (2048 only)  
 0x08000000  NON_CONNECTION_HW_SUPPORT (2048 only)  
 0x40000000  PAGE_SCAN_HW_SUPPORT_BIT_0 (2048 only)  
 0x80000000  PAGE_SCAN_HW_SUPPORT_BIT_1 (2048 only)  


Channel_ID Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for non-BCM2035 command when WCS collaboration solution is selected. A value of 16 is not a valid WLAN channel ID, and therefore a value of 16 will preserve allow the WLAN hardware to preserve its channel ID assignment. Any other value will force the WLAN to use the specified channel ID.


Number_Bypassed Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for non-BCM2035 command when WCS collaboration solution is selected. The number of Bluetooth channels to be blocked across a WLAN channel.


RESERVED_1 Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Only present for non-BCM2035 command when WCS collaboration solution is not selected. This serves as padding to fix the alignment of Priority_Inverse_Threshold to account for Channel_ID and Number_Bypassed.


Priority_Inverse_Threshold Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for non-BCM2035 command. Effective if INCREASE_PRIORITY_AFTER_DEFFER_ENABLED is enabled. This paramter defines after how many frames defered by the WLAN, the the priority of that defered frame will be increased


Configuration_Flags_1 Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Additional configuration flags.

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00000001  COEX auto selection   
 0x00000002  COEX auto pad config   
 0x00100000  Back power workaround   
 0x00200000  Sample Rx   
 0x00400000  Dynamic LCU reset   
 0x00800000  Simurx workaround   
 0x01000000  5Wire support   
 0x02000000  A2DP_ACL_Priority_inv   
 0x04000000  EIR scan mode   
 0x08000000  Nonconnection LCU reset   
 0x10000000  Connection HW support   
 0x40000000  Nonconnection multi-sampling   
 0x80000000  HW coexistence mode   
 0x00010000  BLE COEX Nokia Mode  
 0x00008000  BLE COEX Enable  


Configuration_Flags_2 Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Additional configuration flags.

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x02000000  BLE Connection high priority  
 0x01000000  BLE INIT high priority  
 0x00800000  BLE SCAN high priority  
 0x00400000  BLE ADV high priority  
 0x40000000  PS and FHS low priority  
 0x80000000  LMP high priority  


2035_Collaboration_Solution Size: 0 bytes (abstract)

    Type: uint8

An abstraction from CS_Encoded to indicate, for BCM2035, which collaboration solution to enable.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  No collaboration  
 0x1  2 pin 2 pin solution  
 0x2  4 pin 2 pin solution  


GPIO_PCM_Interface Size: 0 bytes (abstract)

    Type: uint8

An abstraction from CS_Encoded to indicate, for BCM2035, which GPIOs to use for collaborative coexistance.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  GPIO1/GPIO7 (uart interface configuration)  
 0x1  PCM_IN/PCM_OUT (used with uart or usb when PCM is not required)  
 0x2  GPIO1/GPIO0 (usb interface when sideband power signalling not required)  
 0x3  GPIO6/GPIO5 (uart or usb when EEPROM is not in system)  
 0x4  GPIO4/GPIO5 (uart or usb when EEPROM is not in system)  


Low_Priority_Frame_Timer Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is not set to disable collaborative coexistance. The timer controls how much delay will add on for low priority tasks. For example, ACL throughput is consider low priority relative to WLAN throughput. Units are in Bluetooth Frames (1.25ms).


PAGE_R0_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to R0 page.


PAGE_R1_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to R1 page.


PAGE_R2_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to R2 page.


PAGE_SCAN_R0_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to R0 page scan.


PAGE_SCAN_R1_L_200MS_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to R1 page scan when the scan window is less than 200ms.


PAGE_SCAN_R1_G_200MS_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to R1 page scan when the scan window is greater than 200ms.


PAGE_SCAN_R2_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to R2 page scan.


PAGE_RESPONSE_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to page response.


INQUIRY_RESPONSE_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to inquiry response.


ACL_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to ACL data transmission.


HID_ACTIVE_SNIFF_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to HID active sniff.


HID_LP_SNIFF_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to HID low power sniff.


HID_NON_HID_SNIFF_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to sniff for devices other than HIDs.


HID_RETURN_FROM_PARK_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to returning a HID from a parked state.


STANDBY_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to the IDLE task.


AFH_RSSI_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to AFH RSSI.


BROADCAST_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to broadcasting.


INQUIRY_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to inquiry.


PAGE_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to paging.


TPOLL_EXPIRE_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned when Tpoll is the scheduled task in a master role.


TPOLL_SNIFFTRANS_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to the sniff transition mode.


INQUIRY_SCAN_1_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to inquiry scan, mode 1 ( RX ID).


INQUIRY_SCAN_2_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to inquiry scan, mode 2 (RX ID and TX FHS).


PAGE_SCAN_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to page scan.


M_S_SWITCH_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to negotiating a master/slave switch.


NEW_CONNECTION_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to new connection mode (POLL/NULL exchange).


8051_CMD_CONN_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to the initial connection setup mode.


MODULO_CALC_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned when a modulo calulation is done for park or sniff.


RETURN_FROM_HOLD_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to returning from a hold state.


SNIFF_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to sniff.


SCO_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to SCO.


PARK_BEACON_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to a park beacon.


AFH_INSTANT_Priority Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Only present for BCM2035 architecture if 2035_Collaboration_Solution is set to 4 pin 2 pin solution. The priority assigned to an AFH instant.




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Write_RF_Attenuation_Table

OCF 0x043

Description:

This command replaces the default output power attenuation table and the test mode output power attenuation table. For the BCM2035, a patch is required to enable support for this command.



Command Parameters:

Power_Table_Length Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Number of entries in the new output power attenuation table.


Test_Mode_Power_Table_Length Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Number of entries in the new test mode output power attenuation table.


Attenuation[0] Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Attenuation in dB for the associated entry in the new output power attenuation table. This parameter will be repeated for Power_Table_Length, with Attenuation and Register_Value parameters interleaved according to Bluetooth standard array parameter treatment.


Register_Value[0] Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Power register value for the associated entry in the new output power attenuation table. This parameter will be repeated for Power_Table_Length, with Attenuation and Register_Value parameters interleaved according to Bluetooth standard array parameter treatment.


Test_Mode_Attenuation[0] Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Attenuation in dB for the associated entry in the new test mode output power attenuation table. This parameter will be repeated for Test_Mode_Power_Table_Length, with Test_Mode_Attenuation and Test_Mode_Register_Value parameters interleaved according to Bluetooth standard array parameter treatment.


Test_Mode_Register_Value[0] Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Power register value for the associated entry in the new test mode output power attenuation table. This parameter will be repeated for Test_Mode_Power_Table_Length, with Test_Mode_Attenuation and Test_Mode_Register_Value parameters interleaved according to Bluetooth standard array parameter treatment.




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Configure_Sleep_Mode

OCF 0x047

Description:

Sets the configurable parameters of sleep mode behavior.



Command Parameters:

Sleep_Config Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Selects sleep/wakeup options

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x1  Enable  
 0x2  Power off  
 0x4  Early mask  
 0x8  Forever  


CR_Wake_Bit Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Defines which GPIO or other external event causes early wake up

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x001  UDC suspend  
 0x002  RTS wake on high, SPI CS detect  
 0x004  RTS wake on low going active, SPI CS detect  
 0x008  CTS wake on high  
 0x010  CTS wake on low going active  
 0x020  RX wake on high  
 0x040  RX wake on low going active  
 0x080  GPIO 0  
 0x100  GPIO 0 low  
 0x200  GPIO 1  
 0x400  GPIO 1 low  


Sleep_Count Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

The number of LPO cycles the device will sleep for


Warmup_Count Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

The number of LPO cycles required for warm up


PLL_Warmup_Count Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

The number of LPO cycles required for PLL warm up




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Read_Raw_RSSI

OCF 0x048

Description:

This command reads back the raw RSSI value. This command is only supported by flash based systems.



Command Parameters:

Connection_Handle Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Host connection handle




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


Connection_Handle Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Host connection handle


RSSI Size: 1 byte

    Type: int8

The RSSI number as a signed char in the range -110 to 0







Write_Channel_Class_Config

OCF 0x049

Description:

Configures various aspect of AFH channel classification behavior 1. How often channel classification algorithm should run 2. How often active RSSI scan should run



Command Parameters:

afhccInterval Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Interval between channel classification runs (* 125ms)


scanType Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

RSSI scan types

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Legacy RSSI Scan  
 0x1  Pipelined RSSI Scan  
 0x2  BCI RSSI Scan  


activeScanInterval Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Interval in between 2 sequential RSSI scans (* 12.5ms)


reclaimCnt Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Number of active scans before a channel can be reclaimed


reclaimSnr Size: 1 byte

    Type: int8

The strength of noise has to be reclaimSnr dB lower than receive power for reclaim


targetPerGoodSig Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Packet Error Rate (PER) threshold per BT channel under good receive power (/ 255)


targetPerWeakSig Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Packet Error Rate (PER) threshold per BT channel under weak receive power (/ 255)


wifiThreshold_bg Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Number of 1 MHz channels to declaim the presence of 11bg


wifiThreshold_n Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Number of 1 MHz channels to declaim the presence of 11n


Threshold_reserved_1 Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Number of 1 MHz channels to declaim the presence of ...


Threshold_reserved_2 Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Number of 1 MHz channels to declaim the presence of ...




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







IOP_Test_Tx

OCF 0x04A

Description:

Initiates an IOP test for Tx only



Command Parameters:

Stop_Tx_Test Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

If this field is true, it will stop IOP Tx test


Tx_Repeat_Count Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

The number of packets the device is going to send. 0 means sending unlimited packets


LT_ADDR Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

The LT_ADDR in the Tx packet


Frequency Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

The fixed frequency that the tx packet is going to use

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00  2402 MHz  
 0x01  2403 MHz  
 0x02  2404 MHz  
 0x03  2405 MHz  
 0x04  2406 MHz  
 0x05  2407 MHz  
 0x06  2408 MHz  
 0x07  2409 MHz  
 0x08  2410 MHz  
 0x09  2411 MHz  
 0x0A  2412 MHz  
 0x0B  2413 MHz  
 0x0C  2414 MHz  
 0x0D  2415 MHz  
 0x0E  2416 MHz  
 0x0F  2417 MHz  
 0x10  2418 MHz  
 0x11  2419 MHz  
 0x12  2420 MHz  
 0x13  2421 MHz  
 0x14  2422 MHz  
 0x15  2423 MHz  
 0x16  2424 MHz  
 0x17  2425 MHz  
 0x18  2426 MHz  
 0x19  2427 MHz  
 0x1A  2428 MHz  
 0x1B  2429 MHz  
 0x1C  2430 MHz  
 0x1D  2431 MHz  
 0x1E  2432 MHz  
 0x1F  2433 MHz  
 0x20  2434 MHz  
 0x21  2435 MHz  
 0x22  2436 MHz  
 0x23  2437 MHz  
 0x24  2438 MHz  
 0x25  2439 MHz  
 0x26  2440 MHz  
 0x27  2441 MHz  
 0x28  2442 MHz  
 0x29  2443 MHz  
 0x2A  2444 MHz  
 0x2B  2445 MHz  
 0x2C  2446 MHz  
 0x2D  2447 MHz  
 0x2E  2448 MHz  
 0x2F  2449 MHz  
 0x30  2450 MHz  
 0x31  2451 MHz  
 0x32  2452 MHz  
 0x33  2453 MHz  
 0x34  2454 MHz  
 0x35  2455 MHz  
 0x36  2456 MHz  
 0x37  2457 MHz  
 0x38  2458 MHz  
 0x39  2459 MHz  
 0x3A  2460 MHz  
 0x3B  2461 MHz  
 0x3C  2462 MHz  
 0x3D  2463 MHz  
 0x3E  2464 MHz  
 0x3F  2465 MHz  
 0x40  2466 MHz  
 0x41  2467 MHz  
 0x42  2468 MHz  
 0x43  2469 MHz  
 0x44  2470 MHz  
 0x45  2471 MHz  
 0x46  2472 MHz  
 0x47  2473 MHz  
 0x48  2474 MHz  
 0x49  2475 MHz  
 0x4A  2476 MHz  
 0x4B  2477 MHz  
 0x4C  2478 MHz  
 0x4D  2479 MHz  
 0x4E  2480 MHz  


Logical_Channel Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Which logical connection channel the tx packet belongs to

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  ACL EDR  
 0x1  ACL Basic  
 0x2  eSCO EDR  
 0x3  eSCO Basic  
 0x4  SCO Basic  


Packet_Type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

What packet type of the tx packet is

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  NULL  
 0x1  POLL  
 0x2  FHS  
 0x3  DM1  
 0x4  DH1 / 2-DH1  
 0x5  HV1  
 0x6  HV2 / 2-EV3  
 0x7  HV3 / EV3 / 3-EV3  
 0x8  DV / 3-DH1  
 0x9  AUX1 / PS  
 0xA  DM3 / 2-DH3  
 0xB  DH3 / 3-DH3  
 0xC  EV4 / 2-EV5  
 0xD  EV5 / 3-EV5  
 0xE  DM5 / 2-DH5  
 0xF  DH5 / 3-DH5  


Tx_Whitening_Enable Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

Whether to turn on whitening or not


Tx_Power_Level Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

The Tx power level

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  0 dBm  
 0x1  -4 dBm  
 0x2  -8 dBm  
 0x3  -12 dBm  
 0x4  -16 dBm  
 0x5  -20 dBm  
 0x6  -24 dBm  
 0x7  -28 dBm  


Payload_Length Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

The length of the payload in the tx packet




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







IOP_Test_Rx

OCF 0x04B

Description:

Initiates an IOP test for Rx only



Command Parameters:

Stop_Rx_Test Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

If this field is TRUE, it will stop the IOP Rx test


Rx_Repeat_Count Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

The number of packets to receive for this Rx test


LT_ADDR Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

The LT_ADDR in the Rx packet


BD_ADDR Size: 6 bytes

    Type: Bluetooth device address

The BD_ADDR used to generate the access code used to receive packet


Frequency Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

The fixed frequency used to receive packet

 Value  Description  
 0x00  2402 MHz

 0x02  2404 MHz

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

The size of sync window to receive packet

    Type: boolean

Indicate whether resync to master clock is needed or not

    Type: uint8

The guard period for receiving EDR packets

    Type: uint8

Which logical connection channel the Rx packet belongs to

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  ACL EDR  
 0x1  ACL Basic  
 0x2  eSCO EDR  
 0x3  eSCO Basic  
 0x4  SCO Basic

    Type: boolean

Whether to turn on whitening or not


Rx_Length Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

The payload length of Rx packet




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Write_RAM

OCF 0x04C

Description:

Writes data into the ARM's 32-bit linear address space or EEPROM. This command is primarily intended for use when the device has received a Download_Minidriver vendor-specific HCI command, placing it into download mode. A minidriver would typically be downloaded to RAM to facilitate reading or writing firmware and/or config data, and then the minidriver would receive Write_RAM commands to write to flash or EEPROM. When receiving configuration data to RAM, a minidriver is unnecessary and Write_RAM commands containing the configuration data are typically issued immediately after the Download_Minidriver command.



Command Parameters:

Address Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

The address to be written to. Addresses greater than or equal to 0xFF000000 represent a virtual address in an EEPROM, with address 0xFF000000 corresponding to address zero in the EEPROM.


Data Size: up to 251 bytes

    Type: uint8 array

The data to write to the target address.




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Read_RAM

OCF 0x04D

Description:

Reads data from the ARM's 32-bit linear address space or EEPROM. This command is primarily intended for use when the device has received a Download_Minidriver vendor-specific HCI command, placing it into download mode. A minidriver would typically have been downloaded to RAM to facilitate reading or writing firmware and/or config data, and then the minidriver would receive Read_RAM commands to read or verify the contents of its flash or EEPROM.



Command Parameters:

Address Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

The address to be read from. Addresses greater than or equal to 0xFF000000 represent a virtual address in an EEPROM, with address 0xFF000000 corresponding to address zero in the EEPROM. Reads from the EEPROM are limited to 32 bytes when in Bluetooth mode (when a Download_Minidriver vendor-specific HCI command has not been issued to the device).


Length Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

The length of data to be read




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


Data Size: up to 251 bytes

    Type: uint8 array

The data which was read from the requested address.







Launch_RAM

OCF 0x04E

Description:

Jumps into the target address in thumb mode, typically a minidriver entry point, or in the case of an 0xFFFFFFFF target address, an implied Bluetooth mode reentry vector with acceptance of runtime RAM configuration data. This command is primarily intended to vector from firmware in download mode (having received a Download_Minidriver vendor-specific HCI command) into a minidriver which has just been received, to reset the device by jumping to the reset vector when the minidriver is no longer needed, or in the case of an 0xFFFFFFFF target address, to transition from download mode back to bluetooth mode with acceptance of configuration data which was downloaded by Write_RAM vendor-specific HCI commands.



Command Parameters:

Address Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

The address to be written to. A value of 0xFFFFFFFF indicates that a prior series of Write_RAM HCI commands contained a runtime RAM configuration data image, and that the firmware should reboot into Bluetooth mode, using that configuration data.




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Tx_Test

OCF 0x051

Description:

Connectionless transmit test to send Bluetooth packets



Command Parameters:

Local_Device_BD_ADDR Size: 6 bytes

    Type: Bluetooth device address

BD_ADDR for this device


Hopping_Mode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Sets the hopping mode. The Fixed pattern hopping mode will transmit a repeating pattern.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  79 channel  
 0x1  Single frequency  
 0x2  Fixed pattern  


Frequency Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

When Hopping Mode is Single Frequency this param sets the frequency

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00  2402 MHz  
 0x01  2403 MHz  
 0x02  2404 MHz  
 0x03  2405 MHz  
 0x04  2406 MHz  
 0x05  2407 MHz  
 0x06  2408 MHz  
 0x07  2409 MHz  
 0x08  2410 MHz  
 0x09  2411 MHz  
 0x0A  2412 MHz  
 0x0B  2413 MHz  
 0x0C  2414 MHz  
 0x0D  2415 MHz  
 0x0E  2416 MHz  
 0x0F  2417 MHz  
 0x10  2418 MHz  
 0x11  2419 MHz  
 0x12  2420 MHz  
 0x13  2421 MHz  
 0x14  2422 MHz  
 0x15  2423 MHz  
 0x16  2424 MHz  
 0x17  2425 MHz  
 0x18  2426 MHz  
 0x19  2427 MHz  
 0x1A  2428 MHz  
 0x1B  2429 MHz  
 0x1C  2430 MHz  
 0x1D  2431 MHz  
 0x1E  2432 MHz  
 0x1F  2433 MHz  
 0x20  2434 MHz  
 0x21  2435 MHz  
 0x22  2436 MHz  
 0x23  2437 MHz  
 0x24  2438 MHz  
 0x25  2439 MHz  
 0x26  2440 MHz  
 0x27  2441 MHz  
 0x28  2442 MHz  
 0x29  2443 MHz  
 0x2A  2444 MHz  
 0x2B  2445 MHz  
 0x2C  2446 MHz  
 0x2D  2447 MHz  
 0x2E  2448 MHz  
 0x2F  2449 MHz  
 0x30  2450 MHz  
 0x31  2451 MHz  
 0x32  2452 MHz  
 0x33  2453 MHz  
 0x34  2454 MHz  
 0x35  2455 MHz  
 0x36  2456 MHz  
 0x37  2457 MHz  
 0x38  2458 MHz  
 0x39  2459 MHz  
 0x3A  2460 MHz  
 0x3B  2461 MHz  
 0x3C  2462 MHz  
 0x3D  2463 MHz  
 0x3E  2464 MHz  
 0x3F  2465 MHz  
 0x40  2466 MHz  
 0x41  2467 MHz  
 0x42  2468 MHz  
 0x43  2469 MHz  
 0x44  2470 MHz  
 0x45  2471 MHz  
 0x46  2472 MHz  
 0x47  2473 MHz  
 0x48  2474 MHz  
 0x49  2475 MHz  
 0x4A  2476 MHz  
 0x4B  2477 MHz  
 0x4C  2478 MHz  
 0x4D  2479 MHz  
 0x4E  2480 MHz  


Modulation_Type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Sets the data pattern that is continuously transmitted

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x1  0x00 8-bit Pattern  
 0x2  0xFF 8-bit Pattern  
 0x3  0xAA 8-bit Pattern  
 0x9  0xF0 8-bit Pattern  
 0x4  PRBS9 Pattern  


Logical_Channel Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Sets the logical channel. Only ACL Basic is supported if the Hopping_Mode is Fixed pattern.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  ACL EDR  
 0x1  ACL Basic  
 0x2  eSCO EDR  
 0x3  eSCO Basic  
 0x4  SCO Basic  


BB_Packet_Type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Sets the packet type. Only DH1 / 2-DH1 is supported if the Hopping_Mode is Fixed pattern.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  NULL  
 0x1  POLL  
 0x2  FHS  
 0x3  DM1  
 0x4  DH1 / 2-DH1  
 0x5  HV1  
 0x6  HV2 / 2-EV3  
 0x7  HV3 / EV3 / 3-EV3  
 0x8  DV / 3-DH1  
 0x9  AUX1 / PS  
 0xA  DM3 / 2-DH3  
 0xB  DH3 / 3-DH3  
 0xC  EV4 / 2-EV5  
 0xD  EV5 / 3-EV5  
 0xE  DM5 / 2-DH5  
 0xF  DH5 / 3-DH5  


BB_Packet_Length Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

The length in bytes for the BB Packet type selected


Tx_Power_Level Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Sets the Tx output power in dbm

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  0 dBm  
 0x1  -4 dBm  
 0x2  -8 dBm  
 0x3  -12 dBm  
 0x4  -16 dBm  
 0x5  -20 dBm  
 0x6  -24 dBm  
 0x7  -28 dBm  
 0x8  Specify Power in dBm  
 0x9  Specify Power Table index  


Transmit_Power_dBm Size: 1 byte

    Type: int8

If Tx_Power_Level is Integer override, requested output power in dbm


Transmit_Power_Table_Index Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

If Tx_Power_Level is Table index override, requested table index




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Rx_Test

OCF 0x052

Description:

Connectionless receive test for Bluetooth packets



Command Parameters:

Remote_Device_BD_ADDR Size: 6 bytes

    Type: Bluetooth device address

BD_ADDR of the remote transmitting device


Report_Period Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

The report period in milliseconds. If set to 0 the stats will not be sent until the command is issued with the period set to 0xFFFF


Frequency Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

When Hopping_Mode for the peer Tx_Test is Single frequency, sets the receive test frequency. When Hopping_Mode for the peer Tx_Test is Fixed pattern, the Frequency value for the corresponding Tx_Test should likewise be Fixed pattern. The Fixed pattern hopping mode will cause the Rx_Test to attempt synchronization with a transmitter which is transmitting the fixed pattern.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00  2402 MHz  
 0x01  2403 MHz  
 0x02  2404 MHz  
 0x03  2405 MHz  
 0x04  2406 MHz  
 0x05  2407 MHz  
 0x06  2408 MHz  
 0x07  2409 MHz  
 0x08  2410 MHz  
 0x09  2411 MHz  
 0x0A  2412 MHz

 0x17  2425 MHz  
 0x18  2426 MHz  
 0x19  2427 MHz  
 0x1A  2428 MHz  
 0x1B  2429 MHz  
 0x1C  2430 MHz  
 0x1D  2431 MHz  
 0x1E  2432 MHz  
 0x1F  2433 MHz  
 0x20  2434 MHz

 0x31  2451 MHz  
 0x32  2452 MHz  
 0x33  2453 MHz  
 0x34  2454 MHz  
 0x35  2455 MHz  
 0x36  2456 MHz  
 0x37  2457 MHz  
 0x38  2458 MHz  
 0x39  2459 MHz

 0x4B  2477 MHz  
 0x4C  2478 MHz  
 0x4D  2479 MHz  
 0x4E  2480 MHz  
 0xF0  Fixed pattern  


Modulation_Type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Sets the data pattern that is continuously received

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x1  0x00 8-bit pattern  
 0x2  0xFF 8-bit pattern  
 0x3  0xAA 8-bit pattern  
 0x9  0xF0 8-bit pattern  
 0x4  PRBS9 pattern  


Logical_Channel Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Sets the logical channel. Only ACL Basic is supported if the Frequency is set to Fixed pattern.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  ACL EDR  
 0x1  ACL Basic  
 0x2  eSCO EDR  
 0x3  eSCO Basic  
 0x4  SCO Basic  


BB_Packet_Type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Sets the packet type. Only DH1 / 2-DH1 is supported if the Frequency is set to Fixed pattern.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x3  DM1  
 0x4  DH1 / 2-DH1  
 0x5  HV1  
 0x6  HV2 / 2-EV3  
 0x7  HV3 / EV3 / 3-EV3  
 0x8  DV / 3-DH1  
 0x9  AUX1  
 0xA  DM3 / 2-DH3  
 0xB  DH3 / 3-DH3  
 0xC  EV4 / 2-EV5  
 0xD  EV5 / 3-EV5  
 0xE  DM5 / 2-DH5  
 0xF  DH5 / 3-DH5

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

The length in bytes for the BB Packet type selected




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Connectionless_DUT_Loopback_Test

OCF 0x054

Description:

Connectionless DUT Loopback test for Bluetooth packets



Command Parameters:

Remote_Device_BD_ADDR Size: 6 bytes

    Type: Bluetooth device address

BD_ADDR of the remote transmitting device


LT_ADDR Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

The Logical Transport Address of the BT link.


Number_Of_Tests Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Number of tests. When the number is entered as 0 the fw will send a test status only


Retry Offset[0] Size: 6 bits {31:26} in little endian uint32

    Type: unsigned integer

When a timeout occurs, subtract the offset to go back to an earlier test


Number_Packets[0] Size: 15 bits {25:11} in little endian uint32

    Type: unsigned integer

Number of packets to be received for this test


TxPowerIndex[0] Size: 3 bits {10:8} in little endian uint32

    Type: unsigned integer

Power table index to use


RxChannel[0] Size: 7 bits {7:1} in little endian uint32

    Type: unsigned integer

Freq. offset in MHz from 2402 MHz


PacketTableType[0] Size: 1 bits {0:0} in little endian uint32

    Type: unsigned integer

The PacketTableType param as used for LMP negotiation of the table

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Basic rate packet types  
 0x1  EDR packet types  


RetryTimeout[0] Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

The number of 250 mSec periods to use as the retry timeout for this test


TestScenario[0] Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Specifies either loopback mode (RX-TX) or Single Ended Rx only mode with stats sent over-the-air

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Rx-Tx Loopback mode  
 0x1  Rx-only with BER stats  


Retry Offset[1] Size: 6 bits {31:26} in little endian uint32 (if present)

    Type: unsigned integer

When a timeout occurs, subtract the offset to go back to an earlier test


Number_Packets[1] Size: 15 bits {25:11} in little endian uint32 (if present)

    Type: unsigned integer

Number of packets to be received for this test


TxPowerIndex[1] Size: 3 bits {10:8} in little endian uint32 (if present)

    Type: unsigned integer

Power table index to use


RxChannel[1] Size: 7 bits {7:1} in little endian uint32 (if present)

    Type: unsigned integer

Freq. offset in MHz from 2402 MHz


PacketTableType[1] Size: 1 bits {0:0} in little endian uint32 (if present)

    Type: unsigned integer

The PacketTableType param as used for LMP negotiation of the table

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Basic rate packet types  
 0x1  EDR packet types  


RetryTimeout[1] Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

The number of 250 mSec periods to use as the retry timeout for this test


TestScenario[1] Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Specifies either loopback mode (RX-TX) or Single Ended Rx only mode with stats sent over-the-air

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Rx-Tx Loopback mode  
 0x1  Rx-only with BER stats  


Retry Offset[2] Size: 6 bits {31:26} in little endian uint32 (if present)

    Type: unsigned integer

When a timeout occurs, subtract the offset to go back to an earlier test


Number_Packets[2] Size: 15 bits {25:11} in little endian uint32 (if present)

    Type: unsigned integer

Number of packets to be received for this test


TxPowerIndex[2] Size: 3 bits {10:8} in little endian uint32 (if present)

    Type: unsigned integer

Power table index to use


RxChannel[2] Size: 7 bits {7:1} in little endian uint32 (if present)

    Type: unsigned integer

Freq. offset in MHz from 2402 MHz

    Type: unsigned integer

The PacketTableType param as used for LMP negotiation of the table

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Basic rate packet types  
 0x1  EDR packet types  


RetryTimeout[2] Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

The number of 250 mSec periods to use as the retry timeout for this test


TestScenario[2] Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Specifies either loopback mode (RX-TX) or Single Ended Rx only mode with stats sent over-the-air

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Rx-Tx Loopback mode  
 0x1  Rx-only with BER stats

    Type: unsigned integer

When a timeout occurs, subtract the offset to go back to an earlier test


Number_Packets[3] Size: 15 bits {25:11} in little endian uint32 (if present)

    Type: unsigned integer

Number of packets to be received for this test


TxPowerIndex[3] Size: 3 bits {10:8} in little endian uint32 (if present)

    Type: unsigned integer

    Type: unsigned integer

Freq. offset in MHz from 2402 MHz

    Type: unsigned integer

The PacketTableType param as used for LMP negotiation of the table

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Basic rate packet types  
 0x1  EDR packet types  


RetryTimeout[3] Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

The number of 250 mSec periods to use as the retry timeout for this test


TestScenario[3] Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Specifies either loopback mode (RX-TX) or Single Ended Rx only mode with stats sent over-the-air

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Rx-Tx Loopback mode  
 0x1  Rx-only with BER stats

TestScenario[22] Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Specifies either loopback mode (RX-TX) or Single Ended Rx only mode with stats sent over-the-air

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Rx-Tx Loopback mode  
 0x1  Rx-only with BER stats  


Retry Offset[23] Size: 6 bits {31:26} in little endian uint32 (if present)

    Type: unsigned integer

When a timeout occurs, subtract the offset to go back to an earlier test


Number_Packets[23] Size: 15 bits {25:11} in little endian uint32 (if present)

    Type: unsigned integer

Number of packets to be received for this test


TxPowerIndex[23] Size: 3 bits {10:8} in little endian uint32 (if present)

    Type: unsigned integer

Power table index to use

    Type: unsigned integer

Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


TestState Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Specifies test start, test in progress, or test end status


TestRnd Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Specifies the current test index







Connectionless_Tester_Loopback_Test

OCF 0x055

Description:

Connectionless transmit test to send Bluetooth packets



Command Parameters:

Local_Device_BD_ADDR Size: 6 bytes

    Type: Bluetooth device address

BD_ADDR for this device


LT_ADDR Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

The Logical Transport Address of the BT link.


Number_Of_Tests Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Number of tests.


Number_Packets[0] Size: 10 bits {31:22} in little endian uint32

    Type: unsigned integer

Number of packets to be sent for this test


Packet_Type[0] Size: 4 bits {21:18} in little endian uint32

    Type: unsigned integer

Packet Type

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x4  DH1 / 2-DH1  
 0x8  3-DH1  
 0xA  2-DH3  
 0xB  DH3 / 3-DH3  
 0xE  2-DH5  
 0xF  DH5 / 3-DH5  


Packet_Length[0] Size: 10 bits {17:8} in little endian uint32

    Type: unsigned integer

Length of packet


PacketTableType[0] Size: 1 bits {7:7} in little endian uint32

    Type: unsigned integer

The PacketTableType param as used for LMP negotiation of the table

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Basic rate packet types  
 0x1  EDR packet types  


TxChannel[0] Size: 7 bits {6:0} in little endian uint32

    Type: unsigned integer

Freq. offset in MHz from 2402 MHz

    Type: unsigned integer

Packet Type

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x4  DH1 / 2-DH1  
 0x8  3-DH1  
 0xA  2-DH3  
 0xB  DH3 / 3-DH3  
 0xE  2-DH5  
 0xF  DH5 / 3-DH5  


Packet_Length[12] Size: 10 bits {17:8} in little endian uint32 (if present)

    Type: unsigned integer

Length of packet


PacketTableType[12] Size: 1 bits {7:7} in little endian uint32 (if present)

    Type: unsigned integer

The PacketTableType param as used for LMP negotiation of the table

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Basic rate packet types  
 0x1  EDR packet types  


TxChannel[12] Size: 7 bits {6:0} in little endian uint32 (if present)

    Type: unsigned integer

Freq. offset in MHz from 2402 MHz


TestScenario[12] Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Specifies either loopback mode (RX-TX) or Single Ended Rx only mode with stats sent over-the-air

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Rx-Tx Loopback mode  
 0x1  Rx-only with BER stats

TestScenario[27] Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8
