Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Rx-Tx Loopback mode  
 0x1  Rx-only with BER stats  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Enhanced Rx_Test

OCF 0x056

Description:

Connectionless receive test for Bluetooth packets



Command Parameters:

Remote_Device_BD_ADDR Size: 6 bytes

    Type: Bluetooth device address

BD_ADDR of the remote transmitting device


Report_Period Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

The report period in milliseconds. If set to 0 the stats will not be sent until the command is issued with the period set to 0xFFFF


Frequency Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

When Hopping_Mode for the peer Tx_Test is Single frequency, sets the receive test frequency. When Hopping_Mode for the peer Tx_Test is Fixed pattern, the Frequency value for the corresponding Tx_Test should likewise be Fixed pattern. The Fixed pattern hopping mode will cause the Rx_Test to attempt synchronization with a transmitter which is transmitting the fixed pattern.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00  2402 MHz  
 0x01  2403 MHz  
 0x02  2404 MHz  
 0x03  2405 MHz  
 0x04  2406 MHz  
 0x05  2407 MHz  
 0x06  2408 MHz  
 0x07  2409 MHz  
 0x08  2410 MHz  
 0x09  2411 MHz  
 0x0A  2412 MHz  
 0x0B  2413 MHz  
 0x0C  2414 MHz  
 0x0D  2415 MHz  
 0x0E  2416 MHz  
 0x0F  2417 MHz  
 0x10  2418 MHz  
 0x11  2419 MHz  
 0x12  2420 MHz  
 0x13  2421 MHz  
 0x14  2422 MHz  
 0x15  2423 MHz  
 0x16  2424 MHz  
 0x17  2425 MHz  
 0x18  2426 MHz  
 0x19  2427 MHz  
 0x1A  2428 MHz  
 0x1B  2429 MHz  
 0x1C  2430 MHz  
 0x1D  2431 MHz  
 0x1E  2432 MHz  
 0x1F  2433 MHz  
 0x20  2434 MHz  
 0x21  2435 MHz  
 0x22  2436 MHz  
 0x23  2437 MHz  
 0x24  2438 MHz  
 0x25  2439 MHz  
 0x26  2440 MHz  
 0x27  2441 MHz  
 0x28  2442 MHz  
 0x29  2443 MHz  
 0x2A  2444 MHz  
 0x2B  2445 MHz  
 0x2C  2446 MHz  
 0x2D  2447 MHz  
 0x2E  2448 MHz  
 0x2F  2449 MHz  
 0x30  2450 MHz  
 0x31  2451 MHz  
 0x32  2452 MHz  
 0x33  2453 MHz  
 0x34  2454 MHz  
 0x35  2455 MHz  
 0x36  2456 MHz  
 0x37  2457 MHz  
 0x38  2458 MHz  
 0x39  2459 MHz  
 0x3A  2460 MHz  
 0x3B  2461 MHz  
 0x3C  2462 MHz  
 0x3D  2463 MHz  
 0x3E  2464 MHz  
 0x3F  2465 MHz  
 0x40  2466 MHz  
 0x41  2467 MHz  
 0x42  2468 MHz  
 0x43  2469 MHz  
 0x44  2470 MHz  
 0x45  2471 MHz  
 0x46  2472 MHz  
 0x47  2473 MHz  
 0x48  2474 MHz  
 0x49  2475 MHz  
 0x4A  2476 MHz  
 0x4B  2477 MHz  
 0x4C  2478 MHz  
 0x4D  2479 MHz  
 0x4E  2480 MHz  
 0xF0  Fixed pattern  


Modulation_Type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Sets the data pattern that is continuously received

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x1  0x00 8-bit pattern  
 0x2  0xFF 8-bit pattern  
 0x3  0xAA 8-bit pattern  
 0x9  0xF0 8-bit pattern  
 0x4  PRBS9 pattern  


Logical_Channel Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Sets the logical channel. Only ACL Basic is supported if the Frequency is set to Fixed pattern.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  ACL EDR  
 0x1  ACL Basic  
 0x2  eSCO EDR  
 0x3  eSCO Basic  
 0x4  SCO Basic  


BB_Packet_Type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Sets the packet type. Only DH1 / 2-DH1 is supported if the Frequency is set to Fixed pattern.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x3  DM1  
 0x4  DH1 / 2-DH1  
 0x5  HV1  
 0x6  HV2 / 2-EV3  
 0x7  HV3 / EV3 / 3-EV3  
 0x8  DV / 3-DH1  
 0x9  AUX1  
 0xA  DM3 / 2-DH3  
 0xB  DH3 / 3-DH3  
 0xC  EV4 / 2-EV5  
 0xD  EV5 / 3-EV5  
 0xE  DM5 / 2-DH5  
 0xF  DH5 / 3-DH5  


BB_Packet_Length Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

The length in bytes for the BB Packet type selected




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Write_High_Priority_Connection

OCF 0x057

Description:

This command marks a connection as high priority with a Tpoll value of 40 slots. Transmit data pending for this connection cannot be interrupted by transmit data for other connections. The command can also be used to restore normal priority to a connection. This command is only supported by flash based systems.



Command Parameters:

Connection_Handle Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

The connection handle to be marked as normal or high priority.


Priority Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Priority setting for the connection handle

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Normal  
 0x1  High  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Read_2MBit_Flash_CRC

OCF 0x05B

Description:

Adds the value of each byte in the first 2 megabits of flash space, excluding the BD_ADDR and, if present, BTW security key, and returns that 32-bit sum.



Command Parameters:

None



Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


CRC32 Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

The 32-bit CRC.







Factory_Commit_Production_Test_Flag

OCF 0x05C

Description:

Write the one byte manufacturers production test flag that into the configuation file system's volatile section with the ID 0x7E.



Command Parameters:

Flag Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

The one byte production test flag stored in the configuration system's volatile section with ID 0x7E.




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

Write_I2S_Loopback_Mode

OCF 0x066

Description:

This command will configures the i2s interface to collect audio data via the i2s input and returns the data to i2s output. gpio 0 -- I2S DATA OUTPUT gpio 1 -- I2S WS OUTPUT gpio 2 -- I2S BCLK OUTPUT gpio 3 -- I2S DATA INPUT gpio 12 -- I2S BCLK INPUT gpio 13 -- I2S WS INPUT



Command Parameters:

Mode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Turn on or off loopback

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Off  
 0x1  On  


Is_Master Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Select master/slave

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Slave  
 0x1  Master  


Sample_Rate Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Sample rate

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  8 KHz  
 0x1  16 KHz  
 0x2  32 KHz  
 0x3  44.1 KHz  
 0x4  48 KHz  


Sample_Size Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Bits per sample

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  16 bits  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

Write_Synchronous_Packet_Type

OCF 0x06B

Description:

This command programs the disallowed synchronous packet types



Command Parameters:

Connection_Handle Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

The connection handle of the ACL connection being provisioned. The special value of 0xFFFF means this is for all connections.


Packet_Types Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

The synchronous packet type provisioning settings.

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x1  Disallow HV1  
 0x2  Disallow HV2  
 0x4  Disallow HV3  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

Write_RAM_Compressed

OCF 0x071

Description:

Writes data into the ARM's 32-bit linear address space that has been compressed using the compression method corresponding to the method used by dll_ram_init for decompression. The target address is encoded in the compressed data, and there might be more than one target segment.



Command Parameters:

Data Size: up to 252 bytes

    Type: uint8 array

The compressed data to write to the target address.




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

Calculate_CRC

OCF 0x078

Description:

This is a mini-driver command for calculating CRC over a section of the EEPROM. To calculate CRC over EEPROM addresses 0x0000 to 0x2000, issue this command with Address = 0x8000, and Size = 0x2000 This command is intended for quick verification of downloaded images during manufacturing.



Command Parameters:

Address Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

CRC is calculated starting with this address - 0x8000


Size Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

The number of bytes to CRC




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


CRC Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Calculated CRC.

Baseline Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Build baseline number


Build_Number Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Build number







Transport_Suspend

OCF 0x07A

Description:

This command starts the dual stack host switching operation



Command Parameters:

Tick Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

The number of slots device will wait before it flows on the new host


Baud_Rate Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

This is the baud rate the new host will be using 0 means the new host uses the same baud rate as the old host uses




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Transport_Resume

OCF 0x07B

Description:

This command ends the dual stack host switching operation



Command Parameters:

None



Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Baseband_Flow_Control_Override

OCF 0x07C

Description:

This command allows manual control of the baseband packet header flow bit



Command Parameters:

Flow_Control Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Manual flow control on or off and the state of the bit

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Manual flow control disabled  
 0x2  Manual flow control enabled - flow off  
 0x3  Manual flow control enabled - flow on  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Write_Class_1_5_PowerTable

OCF 0x07D

Description:

This command replaces the default Class 1.5 power table and the test mode power attenuation table



Command Parameters:

Fab ID Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Used to match the FAB number with the parts from that FAB only


Radio_Tx_Power_Mode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

When set the radio regs will be configured for class 1.5 mode When cleared the radio regs will be configured for class 2 mode

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Class 2 mode  
 0x1  Class 1.5 mode  


Power_Table_Length Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Number of entries in the new Class 1.5 power table.


Test_Mode_Power_Table_Length Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Number of entries in the new test mode Class 1.5 power table.


Tx_Power_in_dB[0] Size: 1 byte

    Type: int8

Tx Power in dB for the associated entry in the new power table. This parameter will be repeated for Power_Table_Length, with Power and Register_Value parameters interleaved according to Bluetooth standard array parameter treatment.


Register_Value[0] Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Register value for the associated entry in the new power table. This parameter will be repeated for Power_Table_Length, with Power and Register_Value parameters interleaved according to Bluetooth standard array parameter treatment.


Test_Mode_Tx_Power_in_dB[0] Size: 1 byte

    Type: int8

Tx Power in dB for the associated entry in the new power table. This parameter will be repeated for Power_Table_Length, with Power and Register_Value parameters interleaved according to Bluetooth standard array parameter treatment.


Test_Mode_Register_Value[0] Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Register value for the associated entry in the new power table. This parameter will be repeated for Power_Table_Length, with Power and Register_Value parameters interleaved according to Bluetooth standard array parameter treatment.




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Enable_WBS

OCF 0x07E

Description:

This command will enable or disable Wide Band Speech Application.



Command Parameters:

Enable_WBS Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

1 - Enable WBS
0 - Disable WBS


UUID_WBS Size: 2 bytes

    Type: int16

1 - EV3(O) 2 - 2EV3(M)




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Write_Dynamic_SCO_Routing_Change

OCF 0x083

Description:

This command will write dynamic SCO routing enable.



Command Parameters:

SCO_Routing Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Specifies whether the SCO path is through PCM interface or transport

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00  PCM  
 0x01  Transport  
 0x02  CODEC  
 0x03  I2S  
 0xFF  No Change  


SCO_Connections Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Specifies the SCO connection number

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  0  
 0x1  1  
 0x2  2  
 0x3  3  


Connection_Handle[0] Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Specifies the SCO connection handle


SCO_Routing[0] Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Specifies whether the SCO path is through PCM interface or transport

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  PCM  
 0x1  Transport  
 0x2  CODEC  
 0x3  I2S  


PCM_Time_Slot[0] Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

TS Assignment, 4 bit value (Time Slot 0-15)


Input_Coding[0] Size: 8 bits {15:8} in little endian uint16 (if present)

    Type: unsigned integer

Input coding

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Linear  
 0x1  u-law  
 0x2  A-law  


Input_Data_Format[0] Size: 2 bits {7:6} in little endian uint16 (if present)

    Type: unsigned integer

Input date format

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  1's complement  
 0x1  2's complement  
 0x2  Sign-magnitude  
 0x3  Unsigned  


Sample_Size[0] Size: 6 bits {5:0} in little endian uint16 (if present)

    Type: unsigned integer

Sample size

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00  8-bit  
 0x20  16-bit  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

 0x01  16K

 0x03  44.1K  
 0x04  48K  
 0xFF  NA

    Type: uint8

audio mix scale

    Type: uint8

audio mix scale

    Type: uint8

audio mix scale

    Type: uint8

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

    Type: uint8 array

OCF 0x08E

Description:

This command enables or disables MTBS, sets MTBS pin, and MTBS pin assertion state



Command Parameters:

    Type: uint8

Enable or disable MTBS functionality

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Disable  
 0x1  Enable

    Type: uint8

MTBS pin

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  GPIO 0  
 0x1  GPIO 1  
 0x2  GPIO 2  
 0x3  GPIO 6  


MTBS assertion state Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

MTBS assertion state

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Low  
 0x1  High  


MTBS mode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

MTBS mode

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Don't perform scheduled scans  
 0x1  Perform scheduled scans without MTBS estimation  
 0x2  Perform scheduled scans with MTBS estimation 1  
 0x3  Perform scheduled scans with MTBS estimation 2

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

Internal_Capacitor_Tuning

OCF 0x096

Description:

This command takes the index to the CAP adjustment table as an input and writes the associated Cap value to Reg33 and Reg34 for tuning the Internal Capacitor. The trim values may be committed to NVRAM if the Factory_Commit option is chosen.



Command Parameters:

CAP Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

The CAP value is the index to the table containing different Cap values[pF] for tuning the internal capacitor. Each index value results in a fixed amoount of change in the frequency, depending upon the crystal used.


Factory_Commit Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

If 1, commit the CAP index Value to nonvolatile memory. The Factory_Commit option may be executed once and only once.




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Coex_Read_WiMAX_configuration

OCF 0x099

Description:

This command reads WiMAX type.



Command Parameters:

None



Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


WiMAX type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

WiMAX mode

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  NO WiMAX  
 0x1  Relaxed Mode  
 0x2  Maximum Mode  







Coex_Write_WiMAX_configuration

Description:

This command chooses the WiMAX type.

    Type: uint8

WiMAX Mode

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  NO WiMAX  
 0x1  Relaxed Mode  
 0x2  Maximum Mode  




Return Parameters:

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Conditional_Scan_configuration

OCF 0x09D

Description:

This command configures the Conditional Scan.



Command Parameters:

pause1_ticks Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

pause 1 ticks - 12MHz clock - 78 = 6.5us - UINT16 pause1_ticks


pause2_ticks Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

pause 2 ticks - 12MHz clock - 78 = 6.5us - UINT16 pause1_ticks


detectThreshold Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

detectThreshold


delay4RFCalibration Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Delay in us for RF calibration


contCondScanNumCont Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Continuous Scan num of Cont scan


swpPassConfig Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Sweep Pass Config value


swpCountConfig Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Sweep Count config value


exceedthreshCnt Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Exceed Threshold count


swpInc Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Sweep Increment


normalScanCntThreshold Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Normal Scan Count Threshold - Return back to CS after this many scans


scansPerIntervalPostDetect Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Number of scans per interval - scans counter if there is a detection


totalscansPerInterval Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Total number of scans per interval - scans counter


scansInARowThresh Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Number of conditional scans in a row before doing a normal scan


vcoSkipStep Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

VCO SKIP STEP - extra skip in vco increment to fix non-monotonic


calCapsPer1Mhz Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

cal caps per 1MHz freq - UINT8 calCapsPer1Mhz


startRegScanNow Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

Immediate normal scan if any energy is detected


blockNarrowEnable Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

Block Narrow width detections


widebandMHzThresh Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Width in MHz of a wide signal


blockedBandsDistance2Merge Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Threshold distance between 2 signals close enough to merge - in cal cap units.


CS Enabled Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Enable Conditional Scan

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x01  Enabled  
 0x80  Debug Enabled  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

    Type: uint8

Error Insertion to be either Random or Controlled

 Value  Description  
 0x0  Random  
 0x1  Controlled

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Number of Good Packets

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Specifies Number of Errors

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

allowed packet types

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0010  2-DH1  
 0x0100  3-DH1  
 0x0400  2-DH3  
 0x0800  3-DH3  
 0x4000  2-DH5  
 0x8000  3-DH5

 Value  Description  
 0x0001  Null  
 0x0002  Poll  
 0x0008  DM1  
 0x0010  DH1  
 0x0200  AUX  
 0x0400  DM3  
 0x0800  DH3  
 0x4000  DM5  
 0x8000  DH5

 Value  Description

 0x0080  3-EV3

 0x2000  3-EV5

Write_RF_Reprogramming_Table_Masking

OCF 0x0A0

Description:

This command allows the user to modify selected bits in an RF register This command modifies default RF register settings. This command is only supported by flash based systems or systems with the required patch installed.



Command Parameters:

Number_Of_Entries Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Number of settings to modify.


Register_Offset[0] Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

RF Register offset for the associated entry. This parameter will be repeated for Number_Of_Entries, with all array parameters interleaved according to Bluetooth standard array parameter treatment.


Data_Mask[0] Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Data mask which selects which bits in the register will be modified by the entry For example, if the mask is 0x18 only bits 3 and 4 will be modified


Register_Value[0] Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

RF Register value for the associated entry. This parameter will be repeated for Number_Of_Entries, with all array parameters interleaved according to Bluetooth standard array parameter treatment.


Data_Mask[1] Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Data mask which selects which bits in the register will be modified by the entry For example, if the mask is 0x18 only bits 3 and 4 will be modified


Data_Mask[2] Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Data mask which selects which bits in the register will be modified by the entry For example, if the mask is 0x18 only bits 3 and 4 will be modified


Data_Mask[3] Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Data mask which selects which bits in the register will be modified by the entry For example, if the mask is 0x18 only bits 3 and 4 will be modified


Data_Mask[4] Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Data mask which selects which bits in the register will be modified by the entry For example, if the mask is 0x18 only bits 3 and 4 will be modified


Data_Mask[5] Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Data mask which selects which bits in the register will be modified by the entry For example, if the mask is 0x18 only bits 3 and 4 will be modified


Data_Mask[6] Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Data mask which selects which bits in the register will be modified by the entry For example, if the mask is 0x18 only bits 3 and 4 will be modified


Data_Mask[7] Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Data mask which selects which bits in the register will be modified by the entry For example, if the mask is 0x18 only bits 3 and 4 will be modified


Data_Mask[8] Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Data mask which selects which bits in the register will be modified by the entry For example, if the mask is 0x18 only bits 3 and 4 will be modified


Data_Mask[9] Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Data mask which selects which bits in the register will be modified by the entry For example, if the mask is 0x18 only bits 3 and 4 will be modified




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

 0x7  Bluetooth LMP 4.1

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00000001  3-slot packets  
 0x00000002  5-slot packets  
 0x00000004  Encryption  
 0x00000008  Slot offset  
 0x00000010  Timing accuracy  
 0x00000020  Switch  
 0x00000040  Hold mode  
 0x00000080  Sniff mode  
 0x00000100  Park mode

 0x00000400  Channel quality driven data rate  
 0x00000800  SCO link  
 0x00001000  HV2 packets  
 0x00002000  HV3 packets  
 0x00004000  u-law log  
 0x00008000  A-law log  
 0x00010000  CVSD  
 0x00020000  Paging scheme  
 0x00040000  Power control  
 0x00080000  3 transparent SCO data  
 0x00200000  Flow control lag (bit1)  
 0x00400000  Flow control lag (bit2)  
 0x00800000  Broadcast encryption  
 0x01000000  Scatter mode  
 0x02000000  Enhanced data rate ACL 2 Mbps mode  
 0x04000000  Enhanced data rate ACL 3 Mbps mode  
 0x08000000  Enhanced inquiry scan  
 0x10000000  Interlaced inquiry scan  
 0x20000000  Interlaced page scan  
 0x40000000  RSSI with inquiry results  
 0x80000000  Extended SCO link (EV3 packets)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00000001  EV4 packets  
 0x00000002  EV5 packets  
 0x00000004  Absence masks  
 0x00000008  AFH capable slave  
 0x00000010  AFH classification slave

 0x00000100  5-slot enhanced data rate ACL packets

 0x00000800  AFH capable master  
 0x00001000  AFH classification master  
 0x00002000  Enhanced data rate eSCO 2 Mbps mode  
 0x00004000  Enhanced data rate eSCO 3 Mbps mode

 0x00010000  Extended inquiry response  
 0x00080000  Secure Simple Pairing

 0x00400000  Non-flushable Packet Boundary Flag  
 0x01000000  Link Supervision Timeout Changed Event  
 0x02000000  Inquiry Response Tx Power Level  
 0x80000000  Extended features

    Type: uint8

Block LMP PDU

OCF 0x0AC

Description:

This Vendor Spcific Command is used to block all/selective LMP messages



Command Parameters:

Specifies Types LMP Message Blocking Method Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

LMP message blocking method

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Block None  
 0x1  Block All LMP PDU  
 0x2  Specifies the LMP message(s) to go Block  


Opcodes (0 - 31) Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

opcode 1-32 to Block

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00000001  BPCS  
 0x00000002  NAME_REQ  
 0x00000004  NAME_RES  
 0x00000008  ACCEPTED  
 0x00000010  NOT_ACCEPTED  
 0x00000020  CLOCK_OFFSET_REQ  
 0x00000040  CLOCK_OFFSET_RES  
 0x00000080  DETACH  
 0x00000100  IN_RAND  
 0x00000200  COMB_KEY  
 0x00000400  UNIT_KEY  
 0x00000800  AU_RAND  
 0x00001000  SRES  
 0x00002000  TEMP_RAND  
 0x00004000  TEMP_KEY  
 0x00008000  ENCRYPTION_MODE_REQ  
 0x00010000  ENCRYPTION_KEY_SIZE_REQ  
 0x00020000  START_ENCRYPTION_REQ  
 0x00040000  STOP_ENCRYPTION_REQ  
 0x00080000  SWITCH_REQ  
 0x00100000  HOLD  
 0x00200000  HOLD_REQ  
 0x00400000  SNIFF  
 0x00800000  SNIFF_REQ  
 0x01000000  UNSNIFF_REQ  
 0x02000000  PARK_REQ  
 0x04000000  PARK  
 0x08000000  SET_BROADCAST_SCAN_WINDOW  
 0x10000000  MODIFY_BEACON  
 0x20000000  UNPARK_BD_ADDR_REQ  
 0x40000000  UNPARK_PM_ADDR_REQ  
 0x80000000  INCR_POWER_REQ  


Opcodes (32 - 63) Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

opcode 32-64

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00000001  DECR_POWER_REQ  
 0x00000002  MAX_POWER  
 0x00000004  MIN_POWER  
 0x00000008  AUTO_RATE  
 0x00000010  PREFERRED_RATE  
 0x00000020  VERSION_REQ  
 0x00000040  VERSION_RES  
 0x00000080  FEATURES_REQ  
 0x00000100  FEATURES_RES  
 0x00000200  QUALITY_OF_SERVICE  
 0x00000400  QUALITY_OF_SERVICE_REQ  
 0x00000800  SCO_LINK_REQ  
 0x00001000  REMOVE_SCO_LINK_REQ  
 0x00002000  MAX_SLOT  
 0x00004000  MAX_SLOT_REQ  
 0x00008000  TIMING_ACCURACY_REQ  
 0x00010000  TIMING_ACCURACY_RES  
 0x00020000  SETUP_COMPLETE  
 0x00040000  USE_SEMI_PERMANENT_KEY  
 0x00080000  HOST_CONNECTION_REQ  
 0x00100000  SLOT_OFFSET  
 0x00200000  PAGE_MODE_REQ  
 0x00400000  PAGE_SCAN_MODE_REQ  
 0x00800000  SUPERVISION_TIMEOUT  
 0x01000000  TEST_ACTIVATE  
 0x02000000  TEST_CONTROL  
 0x04000000  ENCRYPTION_KEY_SIZE_MASK_REQ  
 0x08000000  ENCRYPTION_KEY_SIZE_MASK_RES  
 0x10000000  SET_AFH  
 0x20000000  ENCAPSULATED_HEADER  
 0x40000000  ENCAPSULATED_PAYLOAD  
 0x80000000  SIMPLE_PAIRING_CONFIRM  


Opcodes (64 - 65) Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

opcode 64-65

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x1  SIMPLE_PAIRING_NUMBER  
 0x2  DHKEY_CHECK  


ExtOpcodes (0 - 31) Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

extopcode to Block

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00000002  ACCEPTED_EXT  
 0x00000004  NOT_ACCEPTED_EXT  
 0x00000008  FEATURES_REQ_EXT  
 0x00000010  FEATURES_RES_EXT  
 0x00000800  PKT_TYPE_TABLE_REQ  
 0x00001000  ESCO_LINK_REQ  
 0x00002000  REMOVE_ESCO_LINK_REQ  
 0x00004000  ABSENCE_NOTIFY  
 0x00008000  MAX_ABSENCE  
 0x00010000  CHANNEL_CLASSIFICATION_REQ  
 0x00020000  CHANNEL_CLASSIFICATION  
 0x00040000  ALIAS_ADDRESS  
 0x00080000  ACTIVE_ADDRESS  
 0x00100000  FIXED_ADDRESS  
 0x00200000  SNIFF_SUBRATING_REQ  
 0x00400000  SNIFF_SUBRATING_RES  
 0x00800000  PAUSE_ENCRYPTION_REQ  
 0x01000000  RESUME_ENCRYPTION_REQ  
 0x02000000  IOCAP_REQ  
 0x04000000  IOCAP_RES  
 0x08000000  NUMERIC_COMPARISON_FAILED  
 0x10000000  PASSKEY_ENTRY_FAILED  
 0x20000000  OOB_FAILED  
 0x40000000  KEYPRESS_NOTIFICATION  
 0x80000000  POWER_CONTROL_REQ  


ExtOpcodes (32 - 63) Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

extopcode to Block

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x1  POWER_CONTROL_RES  
 0x2  PING_REQ  
 0x4  PING_RES  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Read_Boot_Crystal_Status

OCF 0x0AF

Description:

Read/Write boot-time crystal and LPO reference status information



Command Parameters:

None



Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


Frequency Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Number of times samples of repeated for Ch 2. 0 means no repeat.


Num_LPO_Stability_Check_Attempts Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Number of times that 10x10 LPO cycles were counted to verify LPO reference stability.







Set_EIR_Error

OCF 0x0B0

Description:

This command configures the device to respond to Inquiry with the EIR bit in the FHS packet set to one but without any Extended Inquiry Response packet. Or it will insert corrupted CRC into the EIR packet.



Command Parameters:

EIR_Error_Type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Set EIR_Error_Type

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Normal EIR  
 0x1  No EIR packet transmitted  
 0x2  CRC Error in EIR packet  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Sniff_Subrating_Maximum_Local_Latency

OCF 0x0B2

Description:

This command sets the maximum sniff subrating local latency allowed on local device, and indirectly results in limiting the max sniff subrate. It will control the behavior of entire chip (not per connection). And it controls the local device behavior and does not apply to the peer.



Command Parameters:

Maximum_Local_Latency Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Set Maximum local latency value




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Dual_Mic_Calibration

OCF 0x0B3

Description:

This command does dual Mic calibration



Command Parameters:

Options Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Action

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Read status of calibration, return calibration factors.  
 0x1  Start test. Return results. Do not store results to SS  
 0x2  Start test. Return results. Store results to SS if Pass.  
 0x3  Stop test. Return results. Do not store results to SS  
 0x4  Read calibration factors stored in SS.  
 0x5  Store input calibration factors to SS.  


Test duration Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Test duration in number of 5ms frames if the action is to start the test Mic calibration factor for Mic1 if the action is to save calib to SS.


Test failure threshold OR calibration factor Mic1 Size: 2 bytes

    Type: int16

Mic calibration factor for Mic1 if the action is to save calib to SS. Threshold in dB in Q8 format to determine the success of the calibration run.


calibration factor Mic2 Size: 2 bytes

    Type: int16

Mic calibration factor for Mic2 if the action is to save calib to SS.


calibration factor gaindB Size: 2 bytes

    Type: int16

Calibration factor for gaindB if the action is to save calib to SS.




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


Result_status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

The status of the command executed

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  PASS  
 0x1  FAIL  
 0x2  INCOMPLETE  
 0x3  SS_WRITE_FAIL  


Mic1 Correction Factor Size: 2 bytes

    Type: int16

The correctionfactor for Mic1 in dB in Q8 format


Mic2 Correction Factor Size: 2 bytes

    Type: int16

The correctionfactor for Mic2 in dB in Q8 format


gaindB Correction Factor Size: 2 bytes

    Type: int16

The correctionfactor for gaindDb in dB in Q8 format







Set_PLC_On_Off

OCF 0x0B4

Description:

This command enables or disables PLC. The supplied settings are applied to all 3 PLC capable links. This command takes effect only if it is issued when there are no SCO/eSCO connections i.e. before connection setup



Command Parameters:

PLC_configuration Size: 5 bits {7:3} in uint8

    Type: unsigned integer

PLC configuration bitmask

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x01  Update CVSD H/W  
 0x02  Equalization  
 0x04  Volume Control  
 0x08  Fast Clock  
 0x10  Log Samples  


PLC_Type Size: 2 bits {2:1} in uint8

    Type: unsigned integer

Choose between different PLC algorithms. Not all are supported on a given chip

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  No PLC  
 0x1  PLC  
 0x2  PLC (Low cost)  
 0x3  PLC+BEC  


PLC_Enabled Size: 1 bit {0} in uint8

    Type: boolean

Enable or Disable PLC




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

    Type: uint8 array

    Type: Bluetooth device address

    Type: uint8 array




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

    Type: uint8

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

 0x2  OTP Transaction Non-correctable Bit Error  
 0x3  OTP Transaction Timeout Error

Enable_Repeater_Functionality

OCF 0x0CE

Description:

This command shall put controller into a repeater mode whereby the controller interconnects two SCO links from different piconets together thus acting as a repeater.



Command Parameters:

Repeater Functionality Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Select Enable or Disable to enable or disable repeater functionality

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Disable Repeater Functionality  
 0x1  Enable Repeater Functionality  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

 0x0100  no 2-DH3  
 0x0200  no 3-DH3

 0x0800  DH3

Initiate_Multicast_Beacon_Lock

OCF 0x0D3

Description:

Initiates a multicast beacon lock on the slave side



Command Parameters:

BD_ADDR Size: 6 bytes

    Type: Bluetooth device address

BD address of the host that is currently doing a multicast


timeout Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Timeout in BT slots for acquiring the multicast


force_trigger Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Boolean to indicate whether to force the host to initiate a beacon or not

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Disable  
 0x1  Enable  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

Command Parameters:

Return Parameters:

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Super_Peek_Poke_with_BitMask

OCF 0x0D5

Description:

Allows the RF registers and memory space to be read or written with bit mask. The parameters present are dependent on what memory space is being read or written and whether the access is a read or a write.



Command Parameters:

Access_Type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Selects which memory or register space type is to be read or written, and whether it is to be read or written.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  BlueRF_Peek  
 0x1  BlueRF_Poke  
 0x2  ARM_Memory_Peek  
 0x3  ARM_Memory_Poke  
 0x4  PMU_Peek  
 0x5  PMU_Poke  


BlueRF_Address Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Present for RF register reads and writes. Specifies the RF register address to be read or written.


ARM_Memory_Address Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Present for memory reads and writes on ARM-based chips. Specifies the memory address to be read or written. For writes, the memory address must fall on a 32-bit address boundary.


PMU_Reg_Offset Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Present for PMU register reads and writes. Specifies the PMU register address to be read or written.


BitMask8 Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Present for RF or PMU register writes on all chips. Specifies the value to be written.


Value8 Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Present for RF or PMU register writes on all chips. Specifies the value to be written.


BitMask32 Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Present for memory writes on ARM-based chips. Specifies the value to be written.


Value32 Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Present for memory writes on ARM-based chips. Specifies the value to be written.




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


OriginalValue Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

The value read, which is only valid if the access type was a read.


NewValue Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

The value read, which is only valid if the access type was a read.







Enable_H4IBSS

OCF 0x0D7

Description:

This command will activate the selected sleep mode algorithm and specify respective timer thresholds.



Command Parameters:

Sleep_Mode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Sleep mode algorithm selection.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  No sleep mode  
 0x1  N/A  
 0x2  N/A  
 0x3  N/A  
 0x4  H4IBSS  


Idle_Threshold_Host Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Time interval of inactivity before the BT will allow the HT to enter sleep mode.


Idle_Threshold_HC Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Time interval of inactivity before the BT will consider entering sleep mode.


Sleep Guard Time Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Time interval before going to sleep after having sent SLEEP_ACK.


Wake Guard Time Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Time interval to hold RTS low to signal a wakeup to peer device.


Allow_Host_Sleep_During_SCO Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

When this flag is set to 0, the host is not allowed to sleep while an SCO is active. When this flag is set to 1, the host can sleep while an SCO is active. This flag should only be set to 1 if SCO traffic is directed to the PCM interface.


TxDActiveMode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

This flag indicates whether the TxD line should be set high or low when the controller goes to sleep.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Low  
 0x1  High  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







BlueBridge_SPI_Negotiation_Request

OCF 0x0D8

Description:

This command sends SPI Negotiation Request to the slave through Bluebridge master. The slave will response the negotiation request with accepted parameters. Master will use accepted parameters from response from the next transaction.



Command Parameters:

EMPSPI protocol version Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Version of EMPSPI protocol, current version 0x1


RESERCED Size: 2 bits {7:6} in uint8

    Type: unsigned integer

RESERVED


SPI_CLK Size: 3 bits {5:3} in uint8

    Type: unsigned integer

Serial clock rate for SPI interface.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  12 MHz (24MHz tport default)  
 0x1  6 MHz  
 0x2  4 MHz  
 0x3  2.4 MHz  
 0x4  2 MHz  
 0x5  1.5 MHz  
 0x6  1.2 MHz  
 0x7  1 MHz  


SPI_INT polarity Size: 1 bits {2:2} in uint8

    Type: unsigned integer

Active level for SPI INT signal.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Active low  
 0x1  Active high  


SPI_Mode Size: 2 bits {1:0} in uint8

    Type: unsigned integer

SPI operation mode

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  SPI Mode 0  
 0x1  SPI Mode 1  
 0x2  SPI Mode 2  
 0x3  SPI Mode 3  


RESERVED Size: 4 bits {7:4} in uint8

    Type: unsigned integer

RESERVED


Byte enedianness Size: 1 bits {3:3} in uint8

    Type: unsigned integer

Byte endianness for bytes in each word.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Little Endian  
 0x1  Big Endian  


Bit enedianness Size: 1 bits {2:2} in uint8

    Type: unsigned integer

Bit endianness for bits in each byte.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Big Endian  
 0x1  Little Endian  


Word size Size: 2 bits {1:0} in uint8

    Type: unsigned integer

Size of word used for negotiation command.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  8-bits mode  
 0x1  16-bits mode  
 0x2  32-bits mode  


Sleepms1(H-byte) Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

High byte of sleep threshold for slave.


Sleepms0(L-byte) Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Low byte of sleep threshold for slave.




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







BlueBridge_SPI_SleepThreshold_Request

OCF 0x0D9

Description:

The host set the initial SleepThreshold value with the first Negotiation Request. After the negotiation, the host will use SleepThresholdRequest to change it.



Command Parameters:

Sleepms1(H-byte) Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

High byte of sleep threshold for slave.


Sleepms0(L-byte) Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Low byte of sleep threshold for slave.




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Accessory Protocol Command Group

OCF 0x0DA

Description:

The host uses this command group to start/configure/control the customer specific accessory protocol execution, and exchange data involved.



Command Parameters:

Major Opcode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Major opcode of the AP command


Minor Opcode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Minor opcode of the AP command




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Write_OTP_AuxData

OCF 0x0DB

Description:

Writes AUX data into OTP memory. The aux data consists of fab-specific register writes and/or boot code patch information



Command Parameters:

AuxDataLocation Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

The location of AUX data in OTP. The choices are to load data at the start of BT OTP space or following the user data

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Start of BT OTP Space  
 0x1  After the BT user data section  


Lock_OTP Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

OTP lock enable.


Data Size: up to 253 bytes

    Type: uint8 array

The data to write to the target address.




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


OTP_Write_Transaction_Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

OTP Write transaction status.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  OTP Transaction Success  
 0x1  OTP Transaction HW Error  
 0x2  OTP Transaction Non-correctable Bit Error  
 0x3  OTP Transaction Timeout Error  
 0x4  OTP Transaction Status Lock Error  
 0x9  OTP Transaction Insufficient OTP size  
 0xA  OTP Transaction Status Readback Failure  


OTP_Write_Transaction_HW_Status Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

OTP Write transaction HW status.


OTP_Lock_Transaction_Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

OTP Lock transaction status.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  OTP Transaction Success  
 0x1  OTP Transaction HW Error  
 0x2  OTP Transaction Non-correctable Bit Error  
 0x3  OTP Transaction Timeout Error  
 0x4  OTP Transaction Invalid Command  
 0x5  OTP Transaction Not Executed  


OTP_Lock_Transaction_HW_Status Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

OTP Lock transaction HW status.







Initialize_MIP

OCF 0x0DC

Description:

Initialize multicast individual poll



Command Parameters:

Role Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Role of the device

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Master  
 0x1  Slave  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Enter_MIP_Mode

OCF 0x0DD

Description:

Enter Multicast Individual Poll mode



Command Parameters:

Connection_Handle Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Connection handle


Role Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Role of the device

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Master  
 0x1  Slave  


MIP_Mode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

MIP mode

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  A2DP  
 0x1  3D Sync  
 0x2  A2DP + 3D Sync  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Disconnect_MIP_Connection

OCF 0x0DE

Description:

Disconnect multicast individual poll



Command Parameters:

MIP_Identifier Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

The MIP identifier




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Extended_Inquiry_Handshake

OCF 0x0E0

Description:

Extended inquiry with handshake



Command Parameters:

LAP Size: 3 bytes

    Type: uint24 (little endian)

LAP


Inquiry_Length Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Inquiry length


BD_ADDR[0] Size: 6 bytes

    Type: Bluetooth device address

BD address of the device that is being inquired


Message_Length Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Inquiry message length


Message_Contents Size: 17 bytes

    Type: uint8 array

Inquiry message contents




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







UartBridge_Route_Hci_Cmd_To_Uart_Bridge

OCF 0x0E1

Description:

This command is used by chips with UartBridge feature. By this command, we can change the destination (Local BT device or 3rd device) of a HCI Cmd



Command Parameters:

HCI Command Destination Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Select Local BT Device or UartBridge 3rd Device.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Local BT Device  
 0x1  UartBridge 3rd Device  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Olympic Settings

OCF 0x0E2

Description:

This VSC combines all Olympic specific commands.
The format is CommandID,Param1,Param2. The parameter definitions depend on the command.



Command Parameters:

CommandType Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Command ID

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00  num completed packets threshold  
 0x01  RSSI power control Low Hi Thresholds  
 0x02  Remote device timout setting  
 0x03  Enable/Disable HV1 reject  
 0x04  Rx RSSI Threshold for A2DP  
 0x05  Read BT Settings  
 0x06  CVSD passThrough Enable  
 0x07  Ignore FEC request  
 0x08  Link Quality Stats  
 0x09  LE Audio EventCounterOffset  
 0x0A  Read LE Settings  
 0x0B  Change LE Settings  
 0x0C  Tx Power Sweep  
 0x0D  Read Profiling Statistics  
 0x0E  Zone RSSI Threshold  
 0x0F  LE Number of Completed Packets Threshold  
 0x10  LE Set maxTxRx Pairs  
 0x11  Antenna Preference  
 0x12  LE Country Based Power Selection  
 0x13  Country code selection  
 0x14  300KHz Dev Select  
 0x15  Antenna Preference B  
 0x16  Reserved - Set Tx Power Offset  
 0x17  Reserved - Read Tx Power Offset  
 0x18  Configure Slave Latency Support  
 0x19  Configure simult ACL A2DP mode  
 0x1A  Configure Duplicate BDADDR Link Behavior  
 0x1B  Tx Power Cap  
 0x1C  LE Minimum Number Data Channels  
 0x1D  Preferred Rate Notification Event  
 0x1E  ADV duplicate filter bypass/process config  
 0x1F  Coex Feature for Multiple BT HID/BTLE Links  
 0x20  HP EDR Accessory Notification Event  


num completed packets threshold Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Threshold for num completed events generation (set to 1 or 2 packets)


RSSI Low threshold Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

RSSI Low threshold (absolute value from -1 to -80dBm)


RSSI High threshold Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

RSSI High threshold (absolute value from -1 to -80dBm)


LMP timeout Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

LMP timeout to remote device (value = time(s)/0.625)


HV1 reject Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Enable (1) or Disable(0) HV1 reject


Rx RSSI threshold Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

RSSI Low threshold (absolute value from -1 to -80dBm)


CVSD passthrough Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Enable (1) or Disable(0) CVSD Passthrough


FEC status Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Ignore (1) or Accept(0) FEC request


FEC connHandle Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

FEC Ignore Global(0xFFFF) or connectionHandle


ACL Connection Handle Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Connection Handle of ACL Link for Link Stats


Link Qual Stats Features Enable Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Feature Enable

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Disable Reports  
 0x1  Enable TX/RX Stat Report  
 0x2  Enable Rate Change Report  
 0x3  Enable Tx/Rx Stats and Rate Change Reports  


TX Retransmission Count Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

TX Retransmission Count Value


Total TX Count Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Total TX Count Value


RX Retransmission Count Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

RX Retransmission Count Value


Total RX Count Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Total RX Count Value


Event Counter Offset1 Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

31:0 of event counter Offset


LE Connection Handle Size: 16 bits {31:16} in little endian uint32 (if present)

    Type: unsigned integer

Handle of LE connection tagged as LEA{31:16}


LEA Type Size: 4 bits {15:12} in little endian uint32 (if present)

    Type: unsigned integer

LEA direction{15:12}

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  LEA -Output  
 0x1  LEA -Input  
 0x2  LEA -Bidir  


LEA Channel Size: 4 bits {11:8} in little endian uint32 (if present)

    Type: unsigned integer

LEA left/right channel{11:8}

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  LEA Channel 0  
 0x1  LEA Channel 1  


Event Counter Offset2 Size: 8 bits {7:0} in little endian uint32 (if present)

    Type: unsigned integer

39:32 of eventCounter Offset{7:0}


NumConnAttempts Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Number of attempts for sync with peer during connection establishment


Enable Tx Power Sweep Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: boolean

Enable Tx Power Sweep


Tx Power Index Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Tx Power Index


Reset Profiling Statistics Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: boolean

Reset Profiling Statistics


Zone RSSI Threshold (abs) Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Zone RSSI Threshold (absolute value)


LE Number of Completed Packets Threshold Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Threshold for LE num completed events generation (set to 1 or 2 packets)


LE Set maxTxRx Pairs Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

LE Set maxTxRx Pairs


Antenna_Action Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Antenna_Action


Antenna_Configuration Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Antenna_Configuration


Antenna_Param1 Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: int8

Antenna_Param1


Antenna_Param2 Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: int8

Antenna_Param2


Connection Handle Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Connection Handle


Power Setting Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Power Setting


CC_Get0_Set1 Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: boolean

CC get = 0 or set = 1


Country Code Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Country Code


BLE_Pwr_Option_BDR0_LEADV1 Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

LE connection power BDR = 0 or LEADV = 1


Connection Handle Num Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Deviation setting for Connection Handle


Deviation Setting Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Deviation setting selection

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Normal deviation  
 0x1  300Khz deviation  


Enable/Disable Slave Latency Support Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Enable/Disable Slave Latency Support

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Disable  
 0x1  Enable  


Configure simult ACL A2DP mode Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Configure simult ACL A2DP mode

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Disable  
 0x1  Enable  


Dup link delete setting Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Choose link delete upon new conn request same BDaddr

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Reject new link request  
 0x1  Drop exist link and accept new request  


Tx Power Cap Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Tx Power Cap

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  0dB  
 0x1  -4dB  
 0x2  -8dB  
 0x3  -12dB  
 0x4  -16dB  
 0x5  -20dB  


Number of Channels Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Spec minimum is 2. Max possible is 37


Preferred Rate Notification Event Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Enable (1) or Disable(0) Preferred Rate Notification Event


ADV Bitmask Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

32bit mask to select if ADV types should go through or bypass dupe filter


Number of BT/BTLE HID Links Threshold Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Number of BT/BTLE HID Links Threshold


BT/BTLE HID Conn Interval Threshold in BT Frames Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

BT/BTLE HID Conn Interval Threshold


HP EDR Accessory Notification Event Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Enable (1) or Disable(0) HP EDR Accessory Notification Event




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


Data Size: 9 bytes

    Type: uint8 array

Payload is either BT settings:
Num Completed packets Threshold
RSSI High Limit
high limit for Power control requests
RX RSSI low limit for A2DP
LMP Timeout for RNR
enable/disable status of HV1 reject feature
WBS feature support status
WBS feature enable status
CVSD Passthrough enable status
OR LE Settings:
LEA buffer size
Max LE Connections
Max LE Slave connections
Max Available LE Connections
Max Available LE Slave Connections







UartBridge_Set_Uart_Bridge_Parameter

OCF 0x0E7

Description:

This command is used by chips with UartBridge feature. We can change the configuration data by this command.



Command Parameters:

Enable Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Enable or Disable UartBridge

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Disable  
 0x1  Enable  


Baudrate Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Setup Baudrate for UartBridge


Tx DMA Threshold Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Setup Tx DMA Threshold. We can disable Tx DMA by setting value which is larger than maximum packet size.


Rx DMA Threshold Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Setup Rx DMA Threshold We can disable Rx DMA by setting value which is larger than maximum packet size.


Device Type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Setup up 3rd Device Type. It could be BT, NFC, GPS or HDRADIO

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  BT  
 0x1  HDRADIO  
 0x2  GPS  
 0x3  NFC  


Packet Format for Non-BT 3rd Device Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Setup Packet Format for Non-BT 3rd Device.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  HCI  
 0x1  NON_HCI  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Start_DVT_Tinydriver

OCF 0x0F2

Description:

Jumps into tinydriver in ROM and start talking to UART to wait for host to send command and data. And then it will automatically jump to RAM's dvtemb's entry point.



Command Parameters:

None



Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

Read_FW_Info

OCF 0x0FE

Description:

Generic command to get FW info.



Command Parameters:

Info_type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Info Type

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x01  PC Workarounds  
 0x02  Local BPCS Features  
 0x03  Read De-sense Mode  
 0x04  Read UHE Mode  
 0x05  Read RSSI Offset Range  
 0x80  Read Sleep Xtal Gain  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


Info_type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Info Type


Info_len Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Info Length


PC_WA_bitmap Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

PC Workarounds bitmap


PC_WA_avoid_5_slot_packets Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

PC Workarounds Avoid 5 Slots Packets


PC_WA_delay_entering_sleep Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

PC Workarounds Delay Entering Sleep


PC_WA_USB_resume_duration Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

PC Workarounds USB Resume Duration


PC_WA_Reserved Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

PC Workarounds Reserved


PC_WA_Reserved Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

PC Workarounds Reserved


PC_WA_Extended_BitMap Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

PC Workarounds Extended


Local_BPCS_Features Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Local BPCS Features


De-sense Mode Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

De-sense Mode

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x1  Allow sECI to control de-sense  
 0x2  Force BT to never be de-sensed  
 0x3  Force BT to always be de-sensed  


UHE Mode Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

UHE Mode

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  UHE ON  
 0x1  UHE Disabling  
 0x2  UHE OFF  


RSSI Offset Lower Limit Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: int8

RSSI Offset Lower Limit


RSSI Offset Upper Limit Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: int8

RSSI Offset Upper Limit


Sleep Xtal Gain Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Sleep Xtal Gain

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Nominal gain  
 0x1  Max Gain  







BFC Read Scan Enable

OCF 0x101

Description:



Command Parameters:

None



Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


Scan_Enable Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  TBFC Scan disabled  
 0x1  TBFC Scan enabled  







Enable_WBS_Modified

OCF 0x102

Description:

This command will enable or disable Wide Band Speech Application.



Command Parameters:

Enable_WBS Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

1 - Enable WBS
0 - Disable WBS

    Type: int16

1 - EV3(O) 2 - 2EV3(M)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

    Type: boolean

    Type: uint8

Command Parameters:

Periodicity (in seconds) Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)


Connection_Handle Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

connection handle


Event_Type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x01  Average RSSI per channel, LTE Tx active  
 0x02  Average RSSI per channel, LTE Tx not active  
 0x04  Rx Packet Error Rate per channel, LTE Tx active  
 0x08  Rx Packet Error Rate per channel, LTE Tx not active  
 0x10  Tx Retransmission Rate per channel, LTE Tx active  
 0x20  Tx Retransmission Rate per channel, LTE Tx not active  
 0x40  Background RSSI per channel, LTE Tx not active

LTE Enable WCI2 Messages

OCF 0x10E

Description:



Command Parameters:

Receiving Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

bit mask of incoming WCI-2 messages to consider

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x01  Type 0, Real Time Signal Message  
 0x02  Type 1, Transport Control Message  
 0x04  Type 2, Transparent Data Message  
 0x08  Type 3, MWS Inactivity Duration Message  
 0x10  Type 4, MWS Scan Frequency Message  
 0x20  Type 5, RFU  
 0x40  Type 6, Vendor Specific  
 0x80  Type 7, Vendor Specific  


Sending Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

bit mask of outgoing WCI-2 messages allowed to send

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x01  Type 0, Real Time Signal Message  
 0x02  Type 1, Transport Control Message  
 0x04  Type 2, Transparent Data Message  
 0x08  Type 3, RFU  
 0x10  Type 4, RFU  
 0x20  Type 5, RFU  
 0x40  Type 6, Vendor Specific  
 0x80  Type 7, Vendor Specific  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







LTE Enable WCI2 Loopback Testing

OCF 0x10F

Description:



Command Parameters:

LoopbackType Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

0 for receiver, 1 for originator.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  0x0, receiver mode.  
 0x1  0x1, originator mode.  


Enable Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

0 for disable, 1 for enable.


Packet Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

8-bit packet that is sent repeatedly when in originator mode.


Repeat Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

The number of packets to send when in originator mode.




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


Received_Bytes Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Received Bytes from peer test device.

 0x1  Read

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Factory_Cal_Set_Tx_Power

OCF 0x115

Description:

Turns on the TX according to the mode, frequency, and power specified by the parameters. The TX is modulated with a PRBS at a default TX trim setting



Command Parameters:

Mode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

mode

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00  BDR  
 0x01  EDR  
 0x02  LE  
 0x10  BDR_ePA  
 0x11  EDR_ePA  
 0x12  LE_ePA  
 0x20  CountryCode0  
 0x21  CountryCode1  
 0x30  Tx_FrontEnd_config  
 0x40  ultraFast_cal  
 0x41  ultraFast_val  
 0x42  ultraFast_config  
 0x43  ultraFast_end  


Channel Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

BT channel number 0-78.Suggested channels are (8, 24, 40, 56, 72) E.g. equivalent frequencies:[2410,2426,2442,2458,2474]


Transmit Power Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

TX output power level in dBm/.25. range is -80 to 127 (-20 dBm to +20 dBm)


Pad Val Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

For debugging, padVal can be forced using the padVal parameter.set to 0 as default


ePA Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Select max power index for ePA/iPA


Antenna Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Select Antenna


Country Code Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Select Country Code


Power Cap Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Select Power CAP


Tx_mode Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Tx_mode

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  BDR  
 0x1  EDR  
 0x2  LE  


HP path enable Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: boolean

Enable HP path i.e. select high power path


PAGC (pwrRamAd) Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Select PAGC pwrRam address


PadVal Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Select PadVal value


BDR_LE BB_Packet_Type Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Sets the packet type. Fixed pattern.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  LE_dummy  
 0x4  DH1  
 0xB  DH3  
 0xF  DH5  


BDR_LE BB_Packet_Length Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Select BB_Packet_Length for BDR_LE


EDR BB_Packet_Type Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Sets the packet type. Fixed pattern.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x4  2-DH1  
 0x8  3-DH1  
 0xA  2-DH3  
 0xB  3-DH3  
 0xE  2-DH5  
 0xF  3-DH5

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Select BB_Packet_Length for EDR


Repeat sequence Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Repeat sequence value


PadVal min Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Select PadVal min value


PadVal max Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Select PadVal max value


PadVal step Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Select PadVal step


BDR_LE HP path enable Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: boolean

Enable HP path i.e. select high power path for BDR_LE

    Type: uint8

Select max HP PAGC pwrRam address for BDR_LE

    Type: uint8

    Type: uint8

BDR_LE bypass PAGC (pwrRamAd) min Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

    Type: uint8

    Type: uint8

Sets the data pattern that is continuously transmitted

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x1  0x00 8-bit Pattern  
 0x2  0xFF 8-bit Pattern  
 0x3  0xAA 8-bit Pattern  
 0x9  0xF0 8-bit Pattern  
 0x4  PRBS9 Pattern

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

Factory_Cal_Trim_Tx_Power

OCF 0x116

Description:

Trims the output power by the specified dB value. This command is valid only if Factory_Cal_Set_Tx_Power is used earlier to setup and turn on the Tx
Error is represented as dB/.25



Command Parameters:

Error Size: 1 byte

    Type: int8

Error is a signed value to instruct the chip to increase or decrease the power by the desired amount. Range is -16 to 16 (-4 dB to +4 dB)




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

Command complete status


Pad Value Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

New PAD value used for this output power setting

Command Parameters:

None



Return Parameters:

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

Command complete status


Temp Code Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Internal Temp code

LTE Simulator WCI-2 Loopback Testing

OCF 0x119

Description:



Command Parameters:

LoopbackType Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

0 for receiver, 1 for originator.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  0x0, receiver mode.  
 0x1  0x1, originator mode.  


Enable Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

0 for disable, 1 for enable.


Simulator Debug Uart Baud Rate Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

baud rate


Starting byte Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

8-bit packet that is sent repeatedly when in originator mode.


Byte count Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

The number of packets to send when in originator mode.


Interval (unit ms) Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

The interval between two bursts, unit ms


Burst lenth Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

the number of bytes per burst


Increment Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: boolean

transmit in ascending order starting with 'starting byte' if enable.




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


Received_Bytes Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Received Bytes from peer test device.







Write_A2DP_Connection

OCF 0x11A

Description:

This command marks a connection as high priority A2DP. Both A2DP source and A2DP sink are supported. The command can also be used to restore normal priority to a connection.



Command Parameters:

Connection_Handle Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

The connection handle to be marked as normal or high priority A2DP.


Priority Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Priority setting for the connection handle

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Normal ACL  
 0x1  A2DP  


A2DP_Data_Direction Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

A2DP data flow direction

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  A2DP Source  
 0x1  A2DP Sink  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Factory_Cal_Read_Table

OCF 0x11B

Description:

Reads the calibration trim constants table, which can be the table sent to the chip by host or the table at current temperature.



Command Parameters:

TableType Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Table Type

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00  Current power table in use (TCA Adjusted)  
 0x01  Host power table  
 0x02  RSSI Cal table  
 0x03  RSSI debug Cal table  
 0x04  Agc Bank Init Val Bt Pri table  
 0x10  Current CC1 power table  
 0x11  Host CC1 power table  
 0x30  Current Tx_FrontEnd power table  
 0x31  Host Tx_FrontEnd power table  
 0x50  MSF FILE Readback  


ePA Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

ePA or iPA table


Antenna Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Select Antenna


Country Code Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Select Country Code


Power Cap Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Select Power CAP


Transfer Type Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Select Transfer Type


Chunk Number Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Select Chunk Number




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

Command complete status

    Type: uint8

choice

    Type: uint8 array

DBFW

OCF 0x11C

Description:

DBFW VSC for New Foundation (FW2)



Command Parameters:

SubCmd Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Sub Command

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00  -- Trace --  
 0x01   Trace -- Read Config and Status  
 0x02   Trace -- Write Config  
 0x03   Trace -- Poll Traces  
 0x04   Trace -- Test  
 0x10  -- Footprint --  
 0x11   Footprint -- Read Config and Status  
 0x12   Footprint -- Write Config  
 0x13   Footprint -- Reset Log  
 0x14   Footprint -- Dump Log 0 - 107  
 0x15   Footprint -- Dump Log 108 - 215  
 0x16   Footprint -- Dump Log 216 - 323  
 0x17   Footprint -- Dump Log 324 - 431  
 0x18   Footprint -- Dump Log 432 - 511  
 0x20  -- Coredump --  
 0x21   Coredump -- Read Config and Status  
 0x22   Coredump -- Write Config  
 0xF0  -- Trigger Exception  
 0xF4  -- Trigger HARD FAULT Exception  
 0xF5  -- Trigger MEM Exception  
 0xF6  -- Trigger BUS Exception  
 0xF7  -- Trigger USAGE Exception  
 0xF8  -- Trigger WDOG Exception  
 0xF1  -- Call Coredump Functions  
 0xF2  -- Insert Sample Traces and Footprints  
 0x30  -- Assert --  
 0x31   Assert -- Read Config and Status  
 0x32   Assert -- Write Config  
 0x40  -- OTA --  
 0x41   OTA -- Read Config and Status  
 0x42   OTA -- Write Config  
 0x43   OTA -- Tx Enable  
 0x44   OTA -- Print Enable  
 0xF3  -- DBUF Read  


Trace Module Mask Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Module Mask

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00000001  DBFW  
 0x00000002  BTC  
 0x00000004  LC  
 0x00000008  LM  
 0x00000010  HCI  
 0x00000020  TRAN  
 0x00000040  FM  
 0x00000080  BCS  
 0x00000100  ULP  
 0x00000200  UHE  
 0x40000000  Others

    Type: uint8

 Value  Description  
 0x0  DEBUG  
 0x1  INFO  
 0x2  WARNING  
 0x3  CRITICAL

Format Version Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Coredump Info


Output Channel Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Coredump Info

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  HCI  
 0x1  Debug UART Binary  
 0x2  Debug UART ASCII  


Chip ID Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Coredump Info


Warning Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Coredump Info

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00000001  OS Queue Alloc Fail  
 0x00000002  OS Queue Free Fail  
 0x00000004  OS Queue Send Fail  
 0x00000008  OS Queue Send Front Fail  
 0x00000010  OS Block Pool Free Fail  
 0x00000100  OS Exception  
 0x20000000  ERROR  
 0x40000000  ASSERT  
 0x80000000  FATAL  


HCI Version Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Coredump Info


HCI Revision Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Coredump Info


LMP Version Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Coredump Info


Manufacture Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Coredump Info


LMP SubVersion Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Coredump Info


RAM 1 Starting Address Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Coredump Info


RAM 1 Size Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Coredump Info


RAM 2 Starting Address Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Coredump Info


Coredump Info - RAM 2 Size Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Coredump Info







Factory_Cal_RxRssi_Test

OCF 0x11D

Description:

Parameters input for Factory_Cal_RxRssi_Test



Command Parameters:

Step Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

step {1.2.3.4}


Channel Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

BT channel number 0-78. channel = freq - 2402


Power Size: 1 byte

    Type: int8

Rx power level -100 dBm to 0 dBm


Gain_Range Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

gainRange {0 to 4}


Mode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Debugging parameter for any extra calibration mode




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

Command complete status


cal_status Size: 1 byte

    Type: int8

cal_status


tca_rssi_IL_0p1dB Size: 1 byte

    Type: int8

tca_rssi_IL_0p1dB

Write_Local_Supported_Extended_Features

OCF 0x128

Description:

This command will write the device's local supported extended features. Overrides the locally supported extended feature settings. Note that this command is used exclusively for testing purposes and should be used with great care.



Command Parameters:

Extended_LMP_Features (page 1, 31:0) Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Bits 31:0 of the LMP_Extended_Page1_Features bitmap.

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x1  Secure Simple Pairing (Host Support)  
 0x2  LE Supported (Host)  
 0x4  Simultaneous LE and BR/EDR to Same Device Capable (Host)  
 0x8  Secure Connections (Host Support)  


Extended_LMP_Features (page 1, 63:32) Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Bits 63:32 of the LMP_Extended_Page1_Features bitmap.


Extended_LMP_Features (page 2, 31:0) Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Bits 31:0 of the LMP_Extended_Page2_Features bitmap.

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x001  Connectionless Slave Broadcast - Master Operation  
 0x002  Connectionless Slave Broadcast - Slave Operation  
 0x004  Synchronization train (master)  
 0x008  Synchronization train (slave)  
 0x010  Inquiry Response Notification Event  
 0x020  Generalized Interlaced Scan  
 0x040  Coarse Clock Adjustment  
 0x080  Reserved  
 0x100  Secure Connections (Controller Support)  
 0x200  Ping  
 0x400  Slot Availability Mask  
 0x800  Train Nudging  


Extended_LMP_Features (page 2, 63:32) Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Bits 63:32 of the LMP_Extended_Page1_Features bitmap.




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

 0x1  Random Address

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00  Synchronization Train 01 Tx  
 0x01  Synchronization Train 01 Rx  
 0x02  Synchronization Train 02 Tx  
 0x03  Synchronization Train 02 Rx  
 0x04  Synchronization Train 03 Tx  
 0x05  Synchronization Train 03 Rx  
 0x06  Synchronization Train 05 Tx  
 0x07  Synchronization Train 05 Rx  
 0x08  Synchronization Train 06 Tx  
 0x09  Synchronization Train 06 Rx  
 0x0A  CSB 01 Tx  
 0x0B  CSB 01 Rx  
 0x0C  CSB 02 Tx  
 0x0D  CSB 02 Rx  
 0x0E  CSB 04 Tx  
 0x0F  CSB 04 Rx  
 0x10  CSB 05 Tx  
 0x11  CSB 05 Rx  
 0x12  CSB 06 Tx  
 0x13  CSB 06 Rx  
 0x14  CSB 07 Tx  
 0x15  CSB 07 Rx  
 0x16  CSB 08 Tx  
 0x17  CSB 08 Rx  
 0x18  CSB 09 Tx  
 0x19  CSB 09 Rx  
 0x1A  CSB 10 Tx  
 0x1B  CSB 10 Rx  
 0x1C  CSB 11 Tx  
 0x1D  CSB 11 Rx  
 0x1E  Invalid

Old_SVT_Config_Setup

OCF 0x146

Description:

Configure the device as a tester, mainly for qualification.



Command Parameters:

Conformance_Tests Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Special behavior for conformance test cases.

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00000001  Enable_LE_NACK_Peer_Non_Zero_Pkt  
 0x00000002  Enable_LE_NACK_Peer_LL_Pkt  
 0x00000004  Enable_LE_Ignore_Peer_ACK  
 0x00000008  Enable_LE_Ignore_Lost_NACK  
 0x00000010  Enable_TP_CON_MAS_BV_17_C  
 0x00000020  Enable_TP_CON_SLA_BV_18_C  
 0x00000040  Enable_LE_Ping_Rsp_Failure  
 0x00000080  Enable_TP_CON_SLA_BI_06_C  
 0x00000100  Enable_TP_CON_MAS_BV_27_C  
 0x00000200  Enable_TP_CON_SLA_BV_27_C  
 0x00000400  Enable_LE_Conn_Param_Req_Reject  
 0x00000800  Enable_LE_Conn_Fail_To_Establish  
 0x00001000  Enable_LE_Conn_Transmit_Fail  
 0x00002000  Enable_LE_Adv_Conn_Req_Fail  
 0x00004000  Enable_TP_SEC_SLA_BI_01  
 0x00008000  Enable_TP_SEC_MAS_BV_04  
 0x00010000  Enable_TP_SEC_MAS_BV_05  
 0x00020000  Enable_TP_SEC_MAS_BI_01  
 0x00040000  Enable_TP_SEC_MAS_BI_04  
 0x00080000  Enable_TP_SEC_MAS_BI_07  
 0x00100000  Enable_TP_PHYS_INQ_BV_20_tester  
 0x00200000  Enable_TP_PHYS_PAG_BV_21_tester  
 0x00400000  Enable_TP_XCB_BV_12_tester  
 0x00800000  Enable_TP_PROT_ARQ_BV_38_C  
 0x01000000  Enable_TP_PROT_ARQ_BV_39_C  
 0x02000000  Enable_TP_PROT_ARQ_BV_40_C  
 0x04000000  Enable_TP_PROT_ARQ_BV_41_C  
 0x08000000  Enable_TP_PROT_ARQ_BV_42_C  
 0x10000000  Enable_TP_PROT_ARQ_BV_47_C  
 0x20000000  Enable_TP_PROT_ARQ_BV_48_C  
 0x40000000  Enable_TP_PROT_ARQ_BV_49_C

    Type: uint8

 Value  Description

 0x2  Discoverable Undirected Advertising  
 0x3  Non-connectable Undirected Advertising

 Value  Description

 0x2  Chan_38

    Type: uint8

Extended Advertising filter policy

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Allow Scan Request from Any, Allow Connect Request from Any  
 0x1  Allow Scan Request from White List Only, Allow Connect Request from Any  
 0x2  Allow Scan Request from Any, Allow Connect Request from White List Only  
 0x3  Allow Scan Request from White List Only, Allow Connect Request from White List Only

Description:

 0x2  Set_Advt_Data_Multi_Sub_Cmd

 0x4  Set_Random_Addr_Multi_Sub_Cmd

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Multi Advertising min interval

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Multi Advertising max interval
