    Type: uint8

Multi Advertising type

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Connectable Undirected Advertising  
 0x1  Connectable Directed Advertising  
 0x2  Discoverable Undirected Advertising  
 0x3  Non-connectable Undirected Advertising  
 0x4  Connectable Low Duty Cycle Directed Advertising

    Type: uint8

 Value  Description  
 0x0  Public Address  
 0x1  Random Address

 0x3  RPA or Random Address

 0x2  Chan_38

 0x3  Allow Scan Request from White List Only, Allow Connect Request from White List Only

LE_Batch_Scan_Command

OCF 0x156

Description:

This command controls the operation of Google LE Batch Scan feature.



Command Parameters:

Batch_Scan_Opcode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Batch Scan Opcode

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x1  Enable_Customer_Specific_Feature  
 0x2  Set_Batch_Scan_Storage_Parameters  
 0x3  Set_Batch_Scan_Parameters  
 0x4  Read_Batch_Scan_Results  


Enable_Customer_Specific_Feature Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Enable Batch Scan feature flag

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Disable Batch Scan Feature  
 0x1  Enable Batch Scan Feature  


Batch_Scan_Full_Max Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Batch Scan max storage space % for full style batching


Batch_Scan_Truncated_Max Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Batch Scan max storage space % for truncated style batching


Batch_Scan_Notify_Threshold Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Batch Scan total storage usage percentage threshold to send notification


Batch_Scan_Mode Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Batch Scan Mode

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Batch Scan Disabled  
 0x1  Truncated Mode Enabled  
 0x2  Full Mode Enabled  
 0x3  Truncated And Full Mode Enabled  


Duty_Cycle_Scan_Window Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Scan window (in slots) to use for Batch Scan


Duty_Cycle_Scan_Interval Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Scan window (in slots) to use for Batch Scan


Own_Address_Type Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Batch Scan own address type

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Public Address  
 0x1  Random Address  


Batch_Scan_Discard_Rule Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Batch Scan Replacement method

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Discard Oldest  
 0x1  Discard Lowest RSSI  


Batch_Scan_Data_Read_Style Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Command to read Batch Scan records

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x1  Truncated Mode  
 0x2  Full Mode  




Return Parameters:

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

LE_Track_Advertiser

OCF 0x158

Description:

This command adds/deletes an advertiser to be tracked for its state



Command Parameters:

Action Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Action: 0 for ADD and 1 for REMOVE

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Add Advertiser Entry  
 0x1  Delete Advertiser Entry  


Advertiser_Address_Type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Advertiser address type

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Public Address  
 0x1  Random Address  


Advertiser_Address Size: 6 bytes

    Type: Bluetooth device address

Advertiser address


On_Lost_Timeout Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Timeout for detecting lost advertiser




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

Status returned


Track_Advertiser_Action Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Track Advertiser Action Returned


Track_Advertiser_Available_Spaces Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Track Advertiser Available Spaces







LE_Get_Controller_Activity_Energy_Info

OCF 0x159

Description:

This command returns Controller Activity and Energy Info for Android



Command Parameters:

None



Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


total_tx_time_ms Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Total Tx Time


total_rx_time_ms Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Total Rx Time


total_idle_time_ms Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Total Idle Time


total_energy_used Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Total Energy Used (not populated by Broadcom)







LE_Extended_Set_Scan_Parameters

OCF 0x15A

Description:

This command sets extended scan parameters for Android



Command Parameters:

LE_Scan_Type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

LE Scan Type

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Passive Scanning  
 0x1  Active Scanning  


LE_Scan_Interval Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

LE Scan Interval


LE_Scan_Window Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

LE Scan Window


Own_Address_Type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Own Address Type

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Public Address  
 0x1  Random Address  
 0x2  RPA or Public Address  
 0x3  RPA or Random Address  


Scanning_Filter_Policy Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

LE Scan Filter Policy

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Accept all advertisement packets except Directed Adv not directed to you  
 0x1  Ignore advertisement packets not in the White List Only  
 0x2  Accept all undirected, all directed whose initA is RPA, and all directed being addressed to this device  
 0x3  Accept all undirected listed in WL, all directed whose initA is RPA, and all directed being addressed to this device  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







LE_Get_Controller_Debug_Info

OCF 0x15B

Description:

This command turns on controller debug info for Android



Command Parameters:

None



Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

Set_Coarse_Clock_Dragging_In_Sniff

OCF 0x15F

Description:

This sets the coarse clock dragging in Sniff parameters



Command Parameters:

Command_Type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Command type

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Disable Coarse Clock Dragging in Sniff  
 0x1  Enable Coarse Clock Dragging in Sniff with LPO  
 0x2  Enable Coarse Clock Dragging in Sniff with HPX  


PPM_Nudge Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Coarse clock dragging nudge value




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Enable_generic_Wake_on_BLE

OCF 0x160

Description:

This command enables generic wake-on-BLE command



Command Parameters:

Enable Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

0 - Wake-on-BLE mode disabled 1 - Wake-on-BLE mode enabled




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







DF_UCST_Request

OCF 0x166

Description:

This command enables/disables Direction-Finding Unicast Request



Command Parameters:

Connection handle Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Connection Handle


Action Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Action: 0=write, 1=read

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Write  
 0x1  Read  


State Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

State: 0=inactive, 1=active

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Inactive  
 0x1  Active  


DF Type Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Direction-Finding Type

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  NONE  
 0x1  AoA  
 0x2  AoD  


SampleWidth Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Number of bits in DF Extension for each antenna


AntennaSwitchPattern Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Antenna Switch Pattern per spec


SampleSize Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Number of samples in DFE


Interval Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Period to send DF_REQ automatically. 0xFFFFFFFF for one-time only.


ReportsPerEvent Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Number of reports to be cached by FW before sending to host


PayloadLen Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

PayloadData length (bytes)


Payload Size: up to 20 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint8 array

Payload data for DF_RSP packet




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

Status returned


Connection handle Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Connection Handle


Action Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Action: 0=write, 1=read

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Write  
 0x1  Read  


State Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

State: 0=inactive, 1=active

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Inactive  
 0x1  Active  


DF Type Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Direction-Finding Type

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  NONE  
 0x1  AoA  
 0x2  AoD  


SampleWidth Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Number of bits in DF Extension for each antenna


AntennaSwitchPattern Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Antenna Switch Pattern per spec


SampleSize Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Number of samples in DFE


Interval Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Period to send DF_REQ automatically. 0xFFFFFFFF for one-time only


ReportsPerEvent Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Number of reports to be cached by FW before sending to host


PayloadLen Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

PayloadData length (bytes)


Payload Size: up to 20 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint8 array

Payload data for DF_RSP packet

 0x1  Enable

 0x2  DF_REQ rx emulation

Microsoft Commands

OCF 0x178

Description:

This VSC combines all Microsoft specific commands.
The format is CommandID followed by variable parameters based on the command.



Command Parameters:

Command_Type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Command ID

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  MSFT Read Supported Features  
 0x1  MSFT Monitor RSSI  
 0x2  MSFT Cancel Monitor RSSI  
 0x3  MSFT LE Monitor Advertisement  
 0x4  MSFT LE Cancel Monitor Advertisement  
 0x5  MSFT LE Set Advertisemnt Filter Enable  
 0x6  MSFT Read Absolut RSSI  


Connection_Handle Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

The Handle for the connection for which the RSSI has to be monitored


RSSI_Threshold_High Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: int8

RSSI Threshold High


RSSI_Threshold_Low Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: int8

RSSI Threshold Low


RSSI_Threshold_Low_Time_Interval Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

RSSI Threshold Low Time Interval (0x00 to 0x3C seconds)


RSSI_Sampling_Period Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

RSSI Sampling Period (0x00 to 0xFF time in uits of 100 ms)


Condition_Type Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Condition Type

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x1  The condition specified is a patten that has to be matched on the advertisement  
 0x2  The condition specified contains a UUID Type and a UUID  
 0x3  The condition specified is the resolution of an IRK  
 0x4  The condition specified is a Bluetooth address  


Number_of_Patterns Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

The number of patterns specified within the Pattern parameter


Pattern_Data Size: 240 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint8 array

Pattern data


UUID_Type Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

UUID Type

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x1  The UUID is a 16-bit service  
 0x2  The UUID is a 32-bit service  
 0x3  The UUID is a 128-bit service  


UUID Size: 16 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint8 array

UUID


IRK Size: 16 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint8 array

IRK


BD_ADDR_Type Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

BD ADDR Type

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Public Device Address  
 0x1  Random Device Address  


BD_ADDR Size: 6 bytes (if present)

    Type: Bluetooth device address

BD ADDR


Monitor_Handle Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

The Handle for the filter that is being cancelled


Filter_Enable Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Filter Enable

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Filter Disable, Revert to current whitelist behavior but continue monitoring devices  
 0x1  Filter Enable  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


Command_Type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Command ID

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  MSFT Read Supported Features  
 0x1  MSFT Monitor RSSI  
 0x2  MSFT Cancel Monitor RSSI  
 0x3  MSFT LE Monitor Advertisement  
 0x4  MSFT LE Cancel Monitor Advertisement  
 0x5  MSFT LE Set Advertisemnt Filter Enable  
 0x6  MSFT Read Absolute RSSI  


Supported_Features (31:0) Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Supported Features (31:0)

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x1  RSSI Monitoring for BR/EDR connections  
 0x2  RSSI Monitoring for LE connections  
 0x4  RSSI Monitoring of LE advertisements  
 0x8  Advertisement Monitoring of LE advertisements  


Supported_Features (63:32) Size: 4 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Supported Features (63:32)


MSFT_Event_Prefix_Length Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

MSFT Event Prefix Length


MSFT_Event_Prefix Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

MSFT Event Prefix


Monitor_Handle Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Monitor Handle


Connection_Handle Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

connection handle


rssi Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: int8

rssi

 Value  Description  
 0x1  TX  
 0x2  RX  
 0x3  TX+RX

    Type: unsigned integer

    Type: unsigned integer

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Transport  
 0x1  PCM / I2S  
 0xF  Null

    Type: unsigned integer

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Transport  
 0x1  PCM / I2S  
 0xF  Null

 0x0  Linear PCM  
 0x1  Customer Specific 1

 Value  Description

 0x1  Customer Specific 1

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

SVT_Config_Setup

OCF 0x18B

Description:

Configure the device as a tester, mainly for qualification.



Command Parameters:

Test_ID Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Special behavior for conformance test cases.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00  0 ENABLE_NO_TEST  
 0x01  1 ENABLE_LE_NACK_PEER_NON_ZERO_PKT  
 0x02  2 ENABLE_LE_NACK_PEER_LL_PKT  
 0x03  3 ENABLE_LE_IGNORE_PEER_ACK  
 0x04  4 ENABLE_LE_IGNORE_LOST_NACK  
 0x05  5 ENABLE_TP_CON_MAS_BV_17_C  
 0x06  6 ENABLE_TP_CON_SLA_BV_18_C  
 0x07  7 ENABLE_LE_PING_RSP_FAILURE  
 0x08  8 ENABLE_TP_CON_SLA_BI_06_C  
 0x09  9 ENABLE_TP_CON_MAS_BV_27_C  
 0x0A  10 ENABLE_TP_CON_SLA_BV_27_C  
 0x0B  11 ENABLE_LE_CONN_PARAM_REQ_REJECT  
 0x0C  12 ENABLE_LE_CONN_FAIL_TO_ESTABLISH  
 0x0D  13 ENABLE_LE_CONN_TRANSMIT_FAIL  
 0x0E  14 ENABLE_LE_ADV_CONN_REQ_FAIL  
 0x0F  15 ENABLE_TP_SEC_SLA_BI_01  
 0x10  16 ENABLE_TP_SEC_MAS_BV_04  
 0x11  17 ENABLE_TP_SEC_MAS_BV_05  
 0x12  18 ENABLE_TP_SEC_MAS_BI_01  
 0x13  19 ENABLE_TP_SEC_MAS_BI_04  
 0x14  20 ENABLE_TP_SEC_MAS_BI_07  
 0x15  21 ENABLE_TP_PHYS_INQ_BV_20_C_tester  
 0x16  22 ENABLE_TP_PHYS_PAG_BV_21_C_tester  
 0x17  23 ENABLE_TP_XCB_BV_12_C_tester  
 0x18  24 ENABLE_TP_PROT_ARQ_BV_38_C  
 0x19  25 ENABLE_TP_PROT_ARQ_BV_39_C  
 0x1A  26 ENABLE_TP_PROT_ARQ_BV_40_C  
 0x1B  27 ENABLE_TP_PROT_ARQ_BV_41_C  
 0x1C  28 ENABLE_TP_PROT_ARQ_BV_42_C  
 0x1D  29 ENABLE_TP_PROT_ARQ_BV_47_C  
 0x1E  30 ENABLE_TP_PROT_ARQ_BV_48_C  
 0x1F  31 ENABLE_TP_PROT_ARQ_BV_49_C  
 0x20  32 ENABLE_TP_SEC_MAS_BV_12_C  
 0x21  33 ENABLE_TP_SEC_MAS_BV_13_C  
 0x22  34 ENABLE_TP_SEC_SLA_BI_05_C  
 0x23  35 ENABLE_TP_SEC_MAS_BV_14_C  
 0x24  36 ENABLE_TP_SEC_MAS_BI_08_C  
 0x25  37 ENABLE_TP_SEC_MAS_BI_09_C  
 0x26  38 ENABLE_ONLY_BT4_REQUESTS  
 0x27  39 ENABLE_DONT_REPLACE_RPA_ADDR_ADV_EVENT  
 0x28  40 DISABLE_DONT_REPLACE_RPA_ADDR_ADV_EVENT  
 0x29  41 ENABLE_DONT_REPLACE_RPA_ADDR_CONN_EVENT  
 0x2A  42 DISABLE_DONT_REPLACE_RPA_ADDR_CONN_EVENT  
 0x2B  43 ENABLE_AUTO_LMP_EXCHANGE  
 0x2C  44 DISABLE_AUTO_LMP_EXCHANGE  
 0x2D  45 ENABLE_AUTO_VERSION_ID_EXCHANGE  
 0x2E  46 DISABLE_AUTO_VERSION_ID_EXCHANGE  
 0x2F  47 ENABLE_TP_CON_ADV_BV_02_C  
 0x30  48 ENABLE_TP_CON_INI_BV_04_C  
 0x31  49 ENABLE_TP_CON_SLA_BV_TBD_06_C  
 0x32  50 ENABLE_TP_CON_SLA_BV_TBD_12_C  
 0x33  51 ENABLE_TP_CON_MAS_BV_TBD_06_C

 0x35  53 ENABLE_LE2M_PHY_PROCEDURE_COLLISION

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

 0x80000  Enable_Conn_Req_AdvA_Ovr

    Type: uint8

 0x0  Enable/Disable

OCF 0x192

Description:

This command send FLOOD MESH commands to embedded application



Command Parameters:

MeshCommand Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00  FLOODMESH_SUB_OCF_VERSION  
 0x01  FLOODMESH_SUB_OCF_NET_CONFIG  
 0x02  FLOODMESH_SUB_OCF_NODE_CONFIG  
 0x03  FLOODMESH_SUB_OCF_ADD_GROUP  
 0x04  FLOODMESH_SUB_OCF_NET_START  
 0x05  FLOODMESH_SUB_OCF_NET_STOP  
 0x06  FLOODMESH_SUB_OCF_SEND_DATA  
 0x07  FLOODMESH_SUB_OCF_SEND_P2PDATA  
 0x08  FLOODMESH_SUB_OCF_SEND_ACK  
 0x09  FLOODMESH_SUB_OCF_NET_START_BEACON  
 0x0A  FLOODMESH_SUB_OCF_NET_STOP_BEACON  
 0x0B  FLOODMESH_SUB_OCF_NODE_RESTORE  
 0x0C  FLOODMESH_SUB_OCF_NODE_GET_INFO  
 0x0D  FLOODMESH_SUB_OCF_NODE_SET_EVT_MASK  
 0x0E  FLOODMESH_SUB_OCF_ENABLE_CAN_YOU_SEE_ME_PACKET  
 0x0F  FLOODMESH_SUB_OCF_GET_VISIBILITY_MAP  
 0x10  FLOODMESH_SUB_OCF_SEND_P2M_ACK  
 0x11  FLOODMESH_SUB_OCF_START_DISCOVERY_MODE  
 0x12  FLOODMESH_SUB_OCF_STOP_DISCOVERY_MODE  
 0x13  FLOODMESH_SUB_OCF_SCAN_CONFIG  
 0xF0  FLOODMESH_SUB_OCF_DBG_GET_LE_SCAN_PARAM  
 0xF1  FLOODMESH_SUB_OCF_DBG_CYSM

Set_Scan_And_Connection_Params_In_Headless_Mode

OCF 0x194

Description:

Set scan and connection parameters for BLE for the controller in the Headless Mode



Command Parameters:

LE_Scan_Interval Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

This is defined as the time interval from when the Controller started its last LE scan until it begins the subsequent LE scan


LE_Scan_Window Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Amount of time for the duration of the LE scan. LE_Scan_Window shall be less than or equal to LE_Scan_Interval


LE_Conn_Interval_Min Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Minimum value for the connection event interval


LE_Conn_Interval_Max Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Maximum value for the connection event interval


LE_Conn_Latency Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Slave latency for the connection in number of connection events


LE_Supervision_Timeout Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Supervision timeout for the LE Link




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

Read Zero Retran Stat

OCF 0x1A0

Description:

This command to get 0-retrans stat



Command Parameters:

Connection handle Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Connection handle




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


Connection handle Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Indicates the connection handle


zeroRetranArrived Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Indicates the packet sent to chip


zeroRetranAcked Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Indicates ack received for the out packet


zeroRetranNAcked Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Indicates Nack received for the out packet


zeroRetranImplicitNAcked Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Indicates the packets we dropped


zeroRetranRxSEQNRepeat Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Indicates the packet with repeated SN is received







Enable_Burst_Mode_Connection

OCF 0x1A2

Description:

This command marks a connection as high priority A2DP sink. Besides this connection can override the other sniff task if traffic is ongoing This command can also allow TX multi-slots and RX multi-slots packet for this high priority link Both TX and RX traffic are supported



Command Parameters:

Connection_Handle Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

The connection handle to be marked as normal or high priority.


Priority Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Priority setting for the connection handle

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Normal  
 0x1  High  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







ENABLE_SUPER_PICONET

OCF 0x1A3

Description:

This command enable ENABLE_SUPER_PICONET



Command Parameters:

enable_super_piconet Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

enable_super_piconet


shadow_bdaddr Size: 6 bytes

    Type: uint8 array

shadow_bdaddr




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







TxPwr_Cal_Pad_Sweep

OCF 0x1A5

Description:

Turns on the TX according to the mode, frequency, and power specified by the parameters. The TX is modulated with a PRBS at a default TX trim setting



Command Parameters:

Channel Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

BT channel number 0-78.Suggested channels are (8, 24, 40, 56, 72) E.g. equivalent frequencies:[2410,2426,2442,2458,2474]


BDR_LE Packet Type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Sets the packet type. Fixed pattern.

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  LE_dummy  
 0x4  DH1  
 0xB  DH3  
 0xF  DH5  


BDR_LE Packet Length Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Select BB_Packet_Length for BDR_LE


EDR Packet Type Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Sets the packet type Fixed pattern

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x4  2-DH1  
 0x8  3-DH1  
 0xA  2-DH3  
 0xB  3-DH3  
 0xE  2-DH5  
 0xF  3-DH5  


EDR Packet Length Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Select BB_Packet_Length for EDR


Repeat Sequence Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Repeat sequence value


Pad Val Min Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Select PadVal min value


Pad Val Max Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Select PadVal max value


Pad Val Step Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Select padVal step


Mode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Select the mode that will test

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x1  BDR  
 0x2  EDR  
 0x4  LE  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

Command complete status







TxPwr_Cal_Read_Update_Table

OCF 0x1A7

Description:

Reads/Download the calibration trim constants table, which can be the table sent to the chip by host or the table at current temperature.



Command Parameters:

Mode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

read or download the calibration table, 0 = download, 1 = read back

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  download  
 0x1  read back  


TableType Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Table Type

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x1  power table version 1.0

    Type: uint8

    Type: uint8

    Type: int8

    Type: uint8

    Type: uint8

TxPowerTrimTable Size: 20 bytes

    Type: uint8 array

TxPowerTrimTable







Change_Connection_Priority

OCF 0x1A8

Description:

This command marks a connection as high priority with a Tpoll value of 40 slots. Transmit data pending for this connection cannot be interrupted by transmit data for other connections. The command can also be used to restore normal priority to a connection. This command is only supported by flash based systems.



Command Parameters:

Connection_Handle Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

The connection handle to be marked as Option_0(normal), Option_1, or Option_2 priority.


Option Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Option setting for the connection handle

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Normal  
 0x1  A2DP < SNIFF < LE  
 0x2  A2DP < LE < SNIFF  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







SAM_Setup_Command

OCF 0x1AA

Description:

This command is sent by the host to enable SAM_Setup_Command



Command Parameters:

SAM_Setup_Subcommand Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

SAM Subcommand

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00  SAM Request Status  
 0x01  SAM Configure  
 0x02  SAM Define eSAM Slotmap  
 0x03  SAM Define Type0 Submap  
 0x04  SAM Define SIG Slotmap  
 0x05  SAM Activate  
 0x06  SAM Deactivate  
 0xD0  SAM Diagnostics - Request Local Slotmaps  
 0xD1  SAM Diagnostics - Request Remote Slotmaps  
 0xA0  SAM Direct Test - Send Type0 Submap  
 0xA1  SAM Direct Test - Send Slotmap  
 0xA2  SAM Direct Test - Send Sam Switch  
 0xA3  SAM Direct Test - No ID Packet MSS  


Enable_Direct_Test_Mode Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: boolean

Enable Direct Test Mode


Enable_ESAM_Mode Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: boolean

Enable eSAM mode


Enable_SAM_for_other_Links Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: boolean

Enable SAM for other links


Connection_Handle Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Connection Handle


sam_index Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Sam Index


Update_Mode Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Update Mode


Type0_submap Size: 56 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint8 array

type0_submap


Tsam_sm Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Tsam_sm


Nsam_sm Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Nsam_sm


Submaps Size: 48 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint8 array

Submaps


enable Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

enable

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Disable  
 0x1  Enable  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







LE_Enhanced_Transmitter_Test_Hopping

OCF 0x1AB

Description:

This command is a superset of the standard LE_Enhanced_Transmitter_Test that adds hopping support



Command Parameters:

Length_of_Test_Data Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Sets the payload length


Packet_Payload Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Sets the payload type using the spec supported list

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Pseudo-Random bit sequence 9  
 0x1  Pattern of alternating bits '11110000'  
 0x2  Pattern of alternating bits '10101010'  
 0x3  Pseudo-Random bit sequence 15 - Optional  
 0x4  Pattern of All '1' bits - Optional  
 0x5  Pattern of All '0' bits - Optional  
 0x6  Pattern of alternating bits '00001111' - Optional  
 0x7  Pattern of alternating bits '01010101' - Optional  


PHY Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Sets the PHY type as per the spec

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x1  Transmitter set to transmit data at 1Ms/s  
 0x2  Transmitter set to transmit data at 2Ms/s  
 0x3  Transmitter set to use the Coded PHY with S=8  
 0x4  Transmitter set to use the Coded PHY with S=2  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







SMART MESH_COMMAND

OCF 0x1AC

Description:

This VSC is for sending SMART MESH commands to an embedded application



Command Parameters:

subopcode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Mesh sub Command

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x00  SMARTMESH_SUB_OCF_VERSION  
 0x01  SMARTMESH_SUB_OCF_NODE_RESET  
 0x02  SMARTMESH_SUB_OCF_NODE_CONFIG  
 0x03  SMARTMESH_SUB_OCF_NODE_ENABLE  
 0x04  SMARTMESH_SUB_OCF_MESH_START  
 0x05  SMARTMESH_SUB_OCF_ADD_ROAMING_NODE  
 0x06  SMARTMESH_SUB_OCF_DELETE_ROAMING_NODE  
 0x07  SMARTMESH_SUB_OCF_SET_NODE_RELAY_STATE  
 0x10  SMARTMESH_SUB_OCF_NET_KEY_ADD  
 0x11  SMARTMESH_SUB_OCF_NET_KEY_DELETE  
 0x12  SMARTMESH_SUB_OCF_NET_KEY_UPDATE  
 0x13  SMARTMESH_SUB_OCF_NET_ADDRESS_ADD  
 0x20  SMARTMESH_SUB_OCF_APP_KEY_ADD  
 0x21  SMARTMESH_SUB_OCF_APP_KEY_UPDATE  
 0x22  SMARTMESH_SUB_OCF_APP_KEY_DELETE  
 0x23  SMARTMESH_SUB_OCF_APP_ADDR_ADD  
 0x30  SMARTMESH_SUB_OCF_SEND_DATA_COMMAND  
 0x31  SMARTMESH_SUB_OCF_SEND_DEVICE_DATA_COMMAND  
 0x32  SMARTMESH_SUB_OCF_MESH_PACKET_RECIEVED  
 0xF0  SMARTMESH_SUB_OCF_DB_DBG_COMMAND  
 0xF1  SMARTMESH_SUB_OCF_GET_GEN_KEY_COMMAND  
 0xF2  SMARTMESH_SUB_OCF_CRYPT_DBG_COMMAND  
 0xF3  SMARTMESH_SUB_OCF_DBG_GET_MESH_INFO_COMMAND  
 0xF4  SMARTMESH_SUB_OCF_DBG_MESH_RESTORE_COMMAND  
 0xF6  SMARTMESH_SUB_OCF_DBG_ADV_CONFIG  


sub_opcode Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Sub opcode of DB Debug command

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  SMARTMESH_DB_DBG_GET_MESH_SUBOPCODE  
 0x1  SMARTMESH_DB_DBG_GET_NET_SUBOPCODE  
 0x2  SMARTMESH_DB_DBG_GET_APP_SUBOPCODE  


sub_cmd Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Sub command code for Cryptography Debug command

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  SMARTMESH_CRYPT_DBG_GET_ENCRYPT_APP_DATA  
 0x1  SMARTMESH_CRYPT_DBG_GET_ENCRYPT_NET_DATA  
 0x2  SMARTMESH_CRYPT_DBG_GET_ENCRYPT_PACKET  
 0x3  SMARTMESH_CRYPT_DBG_GET_DECRYPT_APP_DATA  
 0x4  SMARTMESH_CRYPT_DBG_GET_DECRYPT_NET_DATA  
 0x5  SMARTMESH_CRYPT_DBG_GET_DECRYPT_PACKET  


mesh_index Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

Mesh Index


net_key_index Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Network Key Index


app_key_index Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Application key Index


mode Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

0x01 means that the Controller will not send the Mesh packet over the air but sends it as Mesh Packet VSE to host

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  OTA Mesh packet  
 0x1  Host Mesh packet  


node_relay_state Size: 1 byte (if present)

    Type: uint8

1 = relay state, 0 = non-relay state

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Set Non-Relay state  
 0x1  Set Relay state  


addr Size: 2 bytes (if present)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Address

    Type: uint8 array

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

    Type: uint8

 0x2  MFI_SUB_OCF_COPY_CERTIFICATE

Enable_BT_Link_Stats_Monitoring

OCF 0x1B0

Description:

This command is used to enable link quality monitoring and report to host whenever the crc errors hec errors and retransmissions increase over the configured thresholds



Command Parameters:

Connection_Handle Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

HCI Connection Handle


Enable_Monitoring Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Enable Monitoring of the BT link


interval Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Interval at which the real time link debug info is verified


max_crc_err_limit Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Max no of crc errors that the link can encounter over the interval


max_retran_limit Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

Max no of retransmissions that is allowed over the interval




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

    Type: uint8

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







HP_EDR_ACCESSORY

OCF 0x1B3

Description:

This command is used to enable High Power Mode on an A2DP link



Command Parameters:

Connection_Handle Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

HCI Connection Handle


Enable Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Enable


max_tx_power (in 0.25dbm increments) Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

max dbm power level(increments of 0.25 db)


RSSI_Threshold Size: 1 byte

    Type: int8

Rssi value (dBm) for threshold




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







bux_read_controller_support

OCF 0x1B4

Description:

bux_read_controller_support



Command Parameters:

None



Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


minor revision Size: 4 bits {7:4} in uint8

    Type: unsigned integer

bit[4-7]: minor revision; bit[0-3]: major revision


major revision Size: 4 bits {3:0} in uint8

    Type: unsigned integer

bit[4-7]: minor revision; bit[0-3]: major revision







bux_set_system_support

OCF 0x1B5

Description:

bux_set_system_support



Command Parameters:

system_bux_support Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

system_bux_support

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  system does not support BUX  
 0x1  system supports BUX  




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







bux_create_connection

OCF 0x1B6

Description:

bux_create_connection



Command Parameters:

BD_ADDR Size: 6 bytes

    Type: Bluetooth device address

BD_ADDR


Packet_Type Size: 2 bytes

    Type: uint16 (little endian)

Packet_Type

Values (may be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0002  no 2-DH1  
 0x0004  no 3-DH1  
 0x0008  DM1  
 0x0010  DH1  
 0x0100  no 2-DH3  
 0x0200  no 3-DH3  
 0x0400  DM3  
 0x0800  DH3  
 0x1000  no 2-DH5  
 0x2000  no 3-DH5  
 0x4000  DM5  
 0x8000  DH5  


Page_Scan_Repetition_Mode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Page_Scan_Repetition_Mode

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  R0  
 0x1  R1  
 0x2  R2  


Page_Scan_Mode Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8

Page_Scan_Mode

Values (may not be combined bitwise):
 Value  Description  
 0x0  Mandatory  
 0x1  Optional Page Scan Mode I  
 0x2  Optional Page Scan Mode II  
 0x3  Optional Page Scan Mode III  


Clock_Offset_Valid Size: 1 bit {15} in uint16

    Type: boolean

Clock_Offset_Valid


Clock_Offset Size: 15 bits {14:0} in little endian uint16

    Type: unsigned integer

Clock_Offset


Allow_Role_Switch Size: 1 byte

    Type: boolean

Clock_Offset




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)

Read_Inquiry_Transmit_Power_Level

OCF 0x1BB

Description:

Read_Inquiry_Transmit_Power_Level



Command Parameters:

None

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)


Inquiry_Transmit_Power_Level Size: 1 byte

    Type: int8

The Inquiry Transmit Power Level in dBm







Sector_Erase

OCF 0x35E

Description:

This command is supported only through a minidriver. The command is used to erase a target sector in a flash device.



Command Parameters:

Address Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

The address of the sector to be erased.




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







Chip_Erase

OCF 0x3CE

Description:

This command is supported only through a minidriver. The command is used to erase a target nonvolatile memory (flash or EEPROM).



Command Parameters:

Address Size: 4 bytes

    Type: uint32 (little endian)

The address of the chip to be erased. 0xFC000000 targets flash, while 0xFF000000 targets EEPROM. Because erasing an EEPROM is a slow process, chip erase status vendor-specific debug events will be sent periodically as the operation proceeds.




Return Parameters:

Status Size: 1 byte

    Type: uint8 (error code per Bluetooth Core Specification)







3. Supported Events

Event Name Event Code SupportedComments
Inquiry Complete   0x01 Yes 
Inquiry Result   0x02 Yes 
Connection Complete   0x03 Yes 
Connection Request   0x04 Yes 
Disconnection Complete   0x05 Yes 
Authentication Complete   0x06 Yes 
Remote Name Request Complete   0x07 Yes 
Encryption Change   0x08 Yes 
Change Connection Link Key Complete   0x09 Yes 
Master Link Key Complete   0x0A Yes 
Read Remote Supported Features Complete   0x0B Yes 
Read Remote Version Information Complete   0x0C Yes 
QoS Setup Complete   0x0D Yes 
Command Complete   0x0E Yes 
Command Status   0x0F Yes 
Hardware Error   0x10 YesThe HCI_Hardware_Error_Event is issued when platform specific hardware errors are detected. The following actions are recommended on the reception of specific hardware errors:

Hardware_Code == 0: UART or USB Parsing Error
The issuing of two consecutive HCI Reset commands are required to recover from this error.

Hardware_Code == 1: Internal Soft Error Major
A major soft error has occurred. The issuing of an HCI Reset command is required to recover from this error.

Hardware_Code == 2: Internal Soft Error Severe
A severe soft error has occurred and soft reset has been issued. A subsequent HCI Reset command needs to be issued to ensure that the Host is in sync with the device. 
Flush Occurred   0x11 Yes 
Role Change   0x12 Yes 
Number Of Completed Packets   0x13 YesACL only 
Mode Change   0x14 Yes 
Return Link Keys   0x15 No 
PIN Code Request   0x16 Yes 
Link Key Request   0x17 Yes 
Link Key Notification   0x18 Yes 
Loopback Command   0x19 No 
Data Buffer Overflow   0x1A No 
Max Slots Change   0x1B Yes 
Read Clock Offset Complete   0x1C Yes 
Connection Packet Type Changed   0x1D Yes 
QoS Violation   0x1E No 
Page Scan Repetition Mode Change   0x20 Yes 
Flow Specification Complete   0x21 Yes 
Inquiry Result with RSSI   0x22 Yes 
Read Remote Extended Features Complete   0x23 Yes 
Synchronous Connection Complete   0x2C Yes 
Synchronous Connection Changed   0x2D Yes 
Sniff Subrate   0x2E Yes 
Extended Inquiry Result   0x2F Yes 
Encryption Key Refresh Complete   0x30 Yes 
IO Capability Request   0x31 Yes 
IO Capability Response   0x32 Yes 
User Confirmation Request   0x33 Yes 
User Passkey Request   0x34 Yes 
Remote OOB Data Request   0x35 Yes 
Simple Pairing Complete   0x36 Yes 
Remote OOB Data Response   0x37 Yes 
Link Supervision Timeout Change   0x38 Yes 
Enhanced Flush Complete   0x39 Yes 
User Passkey Notification   0x3B Yes 
Keypress Notification   0x3C Yes 
Remote Host Supported Features Notification   0x3D Yes 
LE Event   0x3E Yes 
Synchronization Train Complete   0x4F Yes 
Synchronization Train Received   0x50 Yes 
Connectionless Broadcast Receive   0x51 Yes 
Connectionless Broadcast Timeout   0x52 Yes 
Truncated Page Complete   0x53 Yes 
Slave Page Response Timeout   0x54 Yes 
Connectionless Slave Broadcast Channel Map Change   0x55 Yes 
Inquiry Response Notification   0x56 Yes 
Authenticated Payload Timeout Expired   0x57 Yes 
SAM Status Change Event   0x58 Yes 
Vendor Specific Sleep Mode   0xEF No 
Vendor Specific   0xFF YesFirst byte: Vendor Specific event code, 0xFF
Second byte: Event length per Bluetooth core specification
Third byte: Event_Sub_Code

More bytes follow depending on Event_Sub_Code.
